1.1: Blessed is the man that doth not walk in the counsel of the wicked, nor stand in the way of sinners, nor sit in the seat of the scornful.
1.2: But his delight is in the law of the Lord, and in his law doth he meditate day and night.
1.3: For he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of waters, that will bring forth her fruits in due season: whose leaf shall not fade: so whatsoever he shall do, shall prosper.
1.4: The wicked are not so, but as the chaff, which the wind driveth away.
1.5: Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
1.6: For the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous, and the way of the wicked shall perish.

2.1: Why do the heathen rage, and the people murmur in vain.
2.2: The kings of the earth band themselves, and the Princes are assembled together against the Lord, and against his Christ.
2.3: Let us break their bands, and cast their cords from us.
2.4: But he that dwelleth in the heaven shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.
2.5: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure, saying,
2.6: Even I have set my King upon Zion mine holy mountain.
2.7: I will declare the decree: that is, the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my son; this day have I begotten thee.
2.8: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the ends of the earth for thy possession.
2.9: Thou shalt crush them with a scepter of iron, and break them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.
2.10: Be wise now therefore, ye kings: be learned ye judges of the earth.
2.11: Serve the Lord in fear, and rejoice in trembling.
2.12: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish in the way, when his wrath shall suddenly burn. Blessed are all that trust in him.

3.1: Lord, how are mine adversaries increased? how many rise against me?
3.2: Many say to my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
3.3: But thou Lord art a buckler for me, my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
3.4: I did call unto the Lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy mountain. Selah.
3.5: I laid me down and slept, and rose up again: for the Lord sustained me.
3.6: I will not be afraid for ten thousand of the people, that should beset me round about.
3.7: O Lord, arise: help me, my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheekbone: thou hast broken the teeth of the wicked.
3.8: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord, and thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.

4.1: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast set me at liberty, when I was in distress: have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.
4.2: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame, loving vanity, and seeking lies? Selah.
4.3: For be ye sure that the Lord hath chosen to himself a godly man, the Lord will hear when I call unto him.
4.4: Tremble and sin not: examine your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
4.5: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and trust in the Lord.
4.6: Many say, Who will show us any good? but Lord, lift up the light of thy countenance upon us.
4.7: Thou hast given me more joy of heart, than they have had, when their wheat and their wine did abound.
4.8: I will lay me down, and also sleep in peace: for thou, Lord, only makest me dwell in safety.

5.1: Hear my words, O Lord: understand my meditation.
5.2: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my king and my God: for unto thee do I pray.
5.3: Hear my voice in the morning, O Lord: for in the morning will I direct me unto thee, and I will wait.
5.4: For thou art not a God that loveth wickedness, neither shall evil dwell with thee.
5.5: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: for thou hatest all them that work iniquity.
5.6: Thou shalt destroy them that speak lies: the Lord will abhor the bloody man and deceitful.
5.7: But I will come into thine house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thine holy Temple.
5.8: Lead me, O Lord, in thy righteousness, because of mine enemies: make thy way plain before my face.
5.9: For no constancy is in their mouth: within they are very corruption: their throat is an open sepulcher, and they flatter with their tongue.
5.10: Destroy them, O God, let them fall from their counsels: cast them out for the multitude of their iniquities, because they have rebelled against thee.
5.11: And let all them that trust in thee, rejoice and triumph forever, and cover thou them: and let them that love thy name, rejoice in thee.
5.12: For thou Lord, wilt bless the righteous, and with favor wilt compass him, as with a shield.

6.1: O Lord, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chastise me in thy wrath.
6.2: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am weak: O Lord heal me, for my bones are vexed.
6.3: My soul is also sore troubled: but Lord, how long wilt thou delay?
6.4: Return, O Lord: deliver my soul: save me for thy mercy’s sake.
6.5: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall praise thee?
6.6: I fainted in my mourning: I cause my bed every night to swim, and water my couch with my tears.
6.7: Mine eye is dimmed for despite, and sunk in because of all mine enemies.
6.8: Away from me all ye workers of iniquity: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.
6.9: The Lord hath heard my petition: the Lord will receive my prayer.
6.10: All mine enemies shall be confounded and sore vexed: they shall be turned back, and put to shame suddenly.

7.1: O Lord my God, in thee I put my trust: save me from all that persecute me, and deliver me,
7.2: Lest he devour my soul like a lion, and tear it in pieces, while there is none to help.
7.3: O Lord my God, if I have done this thing, if there be any wickedness in mine hands,
7.4: If I have rewarded evil unto him that had peace with me, (yea I have delivered him that vexed me without cause.)
7.5: Then let the enemies persecute my soul, and take it: yea, let him tread my life down upon the earth, and lay mine honor in the dust. Selah.
7.6: Arise, O Lord, in thy wrath, and lift up thyself against the rage of mine enemies, and awake for me according to the judgment that thou hast appointed.
7.7: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return on high.
7.8: The Lord shall judge the people: judge thou me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine innocency that is in me.
7.9: Oh let the malice of the wicked come to an end: but guide thou the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
7.10: My defense is in God, who preserveth the upright in heart.
7.11: God judgeth the righteous, and him that contemneth God, every day.
7.12: Except he turn, he hath whet his sword: he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
7.13: He hath also prepared him deadly weapons: he will ordain his arrows for them that persecute me.
7.14: Behold, he shall travail with wickedness: for he hath conceived mischief, but he shall bring forth a lie.
7.15: He hath made a pit, and dug it, and is fallen into the pit that he made.
7.16: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his cruelty shall fall upon his own pate.
7.17: I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness, and will sing praise to the Name of the Lord most high.

8.1: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy Name in all the world! which hast set thy glory above the heavens.
8.2: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength, because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
8.3: When I behold thine heavens, even the works of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained,
8.4: What is man, say I, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man that thou visitest him?
8.5: For thou hast made him a little lower than God, and crowned him with glory and worship.
8.6: Thou hast made him to have dominion in the works of thine hands, thou hast put all things under his feet:
8.7: All sheep and oxen: yea, and the beasts of the field:
8.8: The fowls of the air, and the fish of the sea, and that which passeth through the paths of the seas.
8.9: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy Name in all the world!

9.1: I will praise the Lord with my whole heart: I will speak of all thy marvelous works.
9.2: I will be glad, and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy Name, O most High.
9.3: For that mine enemies are turned back: they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
9.4: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause: thou art set in the throne, and judgest right.
9.5: Thou hast rebuked the heathen: thou hast destroyed the wicked: thou hast put out their name forever and ever.
9.6: O enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end, and thou hast destroyed the cities: their memorial is perished with them.
9.7: But the Lord shall sit forever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
9.8: For he shall judge the world in righteousness, and shall judge the people with equity.
9.9: The Lord also will be a refuge for the poor, a refuge in due time, even in affliction.
9.10: And they that know thy Name, will trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not failed them that seek thee.
9.11: Sing praises to the Lord, which dwelleth in Zion: show the people his works.
9.12: For when he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth it, and forgetteth not the complaint of the poor.
9.13: Have mercy upon me, O Lord: consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death,
9.14: That I may show all thy praises within the gates of the daughter of Zion, and rejoice in thy salvation.
9.15: The heathen are sunken down in the pit that they made: in the net that they hid, is their foot taken.
9.16: The Lord is known by executing judgment: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands, Higgaion. Selah.
9.17: The wicked shall turn into hell, and all nations that forget God.
9.18: For the poor shall not be always forgotten: the hope of the afflicted shall not perish forever.
9.19: Up Lord: let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
9.20: Put them in fear, O Lord, that the heathen may know that they are but men. Selah.

10.1: Why standest thou far off, O Lord, and hidest thee in due time, even in affliction?
10.2: The wicked with pride doth persecute the poor; let them be taken in the crafts that they have imagined.
10.3: For the wicked hath made boast of his own heart’s desire, and the covetous blesseth himself, he contemneth the Lord.
10.4: The wicked is so proud, that he seeketh not for God: he thinketh always, There is no God.
10.5: His ways always prosper: thy judgments are high above his sight; therefore defieth he all his enemies.
10.6: He saith in his heart, I shall never be moved, nor be in danger.
10.7: His mouth is full of cursing, and deceit, and fraud; under his tongue is mischief and iniquity.
10.8: He lieth in wait in the villages; in the secret places doth he murder the innocent; his eyes are bent against the poor.
10.9: He lieth in wait secretly, even as a lion in his den; he lieth in wait to spoil the poor; he doth spoil the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
10.10: He croucheth and boweth; therefore heaps of the poor do fall by his might.
10.11: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten, he hideth away his face, and will never see.
10.12: Arise, O Lord God, lift up thine hand; forget not the poor.
10.13: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he saith in his heart, Thou wilt not regard.
10.14: Yet thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and wrong; that thou mayest take it into thine hands; the poor committeth himself unto thee; for thou art the helper of the fatherless.
10.15: Break thou the arm of the wicked and malicious; search his wickedness, and thou shalt find none.
10.16: The Lord is King forever and ever; the heathen are destroyed forth of his land.
10.17: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the poor; thou preparest their heart; thou bendest thine ear to them,
10.18: To judge the fatherless and poor, that earthly man cause to fear no more.

11.1: In the Lord put I my trust; how say ye then to my soul, Flee to your mountain as a bird?
11.2: For lo, the wicked bend their bow, and make ready their arrows upon the string, that they may secretly shoot at them which are upright in heart.
11.3: For the foundations are cast down, what hath the righteous done?
11.4: The Lord is in his holy palace; the Lord’s throne is in the heaven; his eyes will consider; his eyelids will try the children of men.
11.5: The Lord will try the righteous; but the wicked, and him that loveth iniquity, doth his soul hate.
11.6: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire, and brimstone, and stormy tempest; this is the portion of their cup.
11.7: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness: his countenance doth behold the just.

12.1: Help Lord, for there is not a godly man left: for the faithful are failed from among the children of men.
12.2: They speak deceitfully every one with his neighbor, flattering with their lips, and speak with a double heart.
12.3: The Lord cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
12.4: Which have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own; who is Lord over us?
12.5: Now for the oppression of the needy, and for the sighs of the poor, I will up, saith the Lord, and will set at liberty him, whom the wicked hath [snared].
12.6: The words of the Lord are pure words, as the silver, tried in a furnace of earth, fined sevenfold.
12.7: Thou wilt keep them, O Lord; thou wilt preserve him from this generation forever.
12.8: The wicked walk on every side; when they are exalted, it is a shame for the sons of men.

13.1: How long wilt thou forget me, O Lord, forever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
13.2: How long shall I take counsel within myself having weariness daily in mine heart? how long shall mine enemy be exalted above me?
13.3: Behold, and hear me, O Lord my God: lighten mine eyes, that I sleep not in death.
13.4: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him: and they that afflict me, rejoice, when I slide.
13.5: But I trust in thy mercy: mine heart shall rejoice in thy salvation; I will sing to the Lord, because he hath dealt lovingly with me.

14.1: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God: they have corrupted, and done an abominable work: there is none that doeth good.
14.2: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that would understand, and seek God.
14.3: All are gone out of the way: they are all corrupt: there is none that doeth good, no not one.
14.4: Do not all the workers of iniquity know that they eat up my people, as they eat bread? they call not upon the Lord.
14.5: There they shall be taken with fear, because God is in the generation of the just.
14.6: You have made a mock at the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is his trust.
14.7:
Oh give salvation unto Israel out of Zion: when the Lord turneth the captivity of his people, then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
Note that of Psalm 14:5-7, which are put into the common translation, and may seem unto some to be left out in this, are not in the same Psalm in the Hebrew text, but rather are put in more fully to express the manners of the wicked, and are gathered out of Psalms 5, 10, 36, 140; Isa. 59, and are alleged by S. Paul, and placed together in Romans 3.

15.1: Lord, who shall dwell in thy Tabernacle? who shall rest in thine holy Mountain?
15.2: He that walketh uprightly and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.
15.3: He that slandereth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbor, nor receiveth a false report against his neighbor.
15.4: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned, but he honoreth them that fear the Lord: he that sweareth to his own hindrance and changeth not.
15.5: He that giveth not his money unto usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent: he that doeth these things, shall never be moved.

16.1: Preserve me, O GOD: for in thee do I trust.
16.2: O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord, Thou art my Lord: my well doing extendeth not to thee,
16.3: But to the Saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent: all my delight is in them.
16.4: The sorrows of them, that offer to another god, shall be multiplied: their offerings of blood will I not offer, neither make mention of their names with my lips.
16.5: The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou shalt maintain my lot.
16.6: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places: yea, I have a fair heritage.
16.7: I will praise the Lord, who hath given me counsel: my reins also teach me in the nights.
16.8: I have set the Lord always before me: for he is at my right hand: therefore I shall not slide.
16.9: Wherefore mine heart is glad, and my tongue rejoiceth: my flesh also doth rest in hope.
16.10: For thou wilt not leave my soul in the grave: neither wilt thou suffer thine holy One to see corruption.
16.11: Thou wilt show me the path of life: in thy presence is the fullness of joy: and at thy right hand there are pleasures forevermore.

17.1: Hear the right, O Lord, consider my cry: hearken unto my prayer of lips unfeigned.
17.2: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence, and let thine eyes behold equity.
17.3: Thou hast proved and visited mine heart in the night: thou hast tried me, and foundest nothing: for I was purposed that my mouth should not offend.
17.4: Concerning the works of men, by the words of thy lips I kept me from the paths of the cruel man.
17.5: Stay my steps in thy paths, that my feet do not slide.
17.6: I have called upon thee: surely thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear to me, and hearken unto my words.
17.7: Show thy marvelous mercies: thou that art the Savior of them that trust in thee, from such as resist thy right hand.
17.8: Keep me as the apple of the eye: hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
17.9: From the wicked that oppress me, from mine enemies, which compass me round about for my soul.
17.10: They are enclosed in their own fat, and they have spoken proudly with their mouth.
17.11: They have compassed us now in our steps: they have set their eyes to bring down to the ground:
17.12: Like as a lion that is greedy of prey, and as it were a Lion’s whelp lurking in secret places.
17.13: Up Lord, disappoint him: cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked with thy sword,
17.14: From men by thine hand, O Lord, from men of the world, who have their portion in this life, whose bellies thou fillest with thine hid treasure: their children have enough, and leave the rest of their substance for their children.
17.15: But I will behold thy face in righteousness, and when I wake, I shall be satisfied with thine image.

18.1: I will love thee dearly, O Lord my strength.
18.2: The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and he that delivereth me, my God and my strength: in him will I trust, my shield, the horn also of my salvation, and my refuge.
18.3: I will call upon the Lord, which is worthy to be praised: so shall I be safe from mine enemies.
18.4: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of wickedness made me afraid.
18.5: The sorrows of the grave have compassed me about: the snares of death overtook me.
18.6: But in my trouble did I call upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his Temple, and my cry did come before him, even into his ears.
18.7: Then the earth trembled and quaked: the foundations also of the mountains moved and shook, because he was angry.
18.8: Smoke went out at his nostrils, and a consuming fire out of his mouth: coals were kindled thereat.
18.9: He bowed the heavens also and came down, and darkness was under his feet.
18.10: And he rode upon Cherub, and did fly, and he came flying upon the wings of the wind.
18.11: He made darkness his secret place, and his pavilion round about him, even darkness of waters, and clouds of the air.
18.12: At the brightness of his presence his clouds passed, hailstones and coals of fire.
18.13: The Lord also thundered in the heaven, and the Highest gave his voice, hailstones and coals of fire.
18.14: Then he sent out his arrows and scattered them, and he increased lightnings and destroyed them.
18.15: And the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuking, O Lord, at the blasting of the breath of thy nostrils.
18.16: He hath sent down from above and taken me: he hath drawn me out of many waters.
18.17: He hath delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hate me: for they were too strong for me.
18.18: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the Lord was my stay.
18.19: He brought me forth also into a large place: he delivered me because he favored me.
18.20: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness: according to the pureness of mine hand he recompensed me:
18.21: Because I kept the ways of the Lord, and did not wickedly against my God.
18.22: For all his laws were before me, and I did not cast away his commandments from me.
18.23: I was upright also with him, and have kept me from my wickedness.
18.24: Therefore the Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness, and according to the pureness of mine hands in his sight.
18.25: With the godly thou wilt show thyself godly: with the upright man thou wilt show thyself upright.
18.26: With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure, and with the froward thou wilt show thyself froward.
18.27: Thus thou wilt save the poor people, and wilt cast down to proud looks.
18.28: Surely thou wilt light my candle: the Lord my God will lighten my darkness.
18.29: For by thee I have broken through an host, and by my God I have leaped over a wall.
18.30: The way of God is uncorrupt: the word of the Lord is tried in the fire: he is a shield to all that trust in him.
18.31: For who is God besides the Lord? and who is mighty save our God?
18.32: God girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way upright.
18.33: He maketh my feet like hind’s feet, and setteth me upon mine high places.
18.34: He teacheth mine hands to fight: so that a bow of brass is broken with mine arms.
18.35: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation, and thy right hand hath stayed me, and thy lovingkindness hath caused me to increase.
18.36: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, and my heels have not slid.
18.37: I have pursued mine enemies, and taken them, and have not turned again till I had consumed them.
18.38: I have wounded them, that they were not able to rise, they are fallen under my feet.
18.39: For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose against me, thou hast subdued under me.
18.40: And thou hast given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.
18.41: They cried, but there was none to save them, even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.
18.42: Then I did beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did tread them flat as the clay in the streets.
18.43: Thou hast delivered me from the contentions of the people: thou hast made me the head of the heathen, a people, whom I have not known, shall serve me.
18.44: As soon as they hear they shall obey me: the strangers shall be in subjection to me.
18.45: Strangers shall shrink away, and fear in their pure chambers.
18.46: Let the Lord live, and blessed be my strength, and the God of my salvation be exalted.
18.47: It is God that giveth me power to avenge me, and subdued the people under me.
18.48: O my deliverer from mine enemies, even thou hast set me up from those that rose against me; thou hast delivered me from the cruel man.
18.49: Therefore I will praise thee, O Lord, among the nations, and will sing unto thy Name.
18.50: Great deliverances giveth he unto his king, and showeth mercy to his anointed, even to David, and to his seed forever.

19.1: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament showeth the work of his hands.
19.2: Day unto day uttereth the same, and night unto night teacheth knowledge.
19.3: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.
19.4: Their line is gone forth through all the earth, and their words into the ends of the world: in them hath he set a tabernacle for the Sun.
19.5: Which cometh forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoiceth like a mighty man to run his race.
19.6: His going out is from the end of the heaven, and his compass is unto the ends of the same, and none is hid from the heat thereof.
19.7: The Law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the Lord is sure, and giveth wisdom unto the simple.
19.8: The statutes of the Lord are right, and rejoice the heart, the commandment of the Lord is pure, and giveth light unto the eyes.
19.9: The fear of the Lord is clean, and endureth forever: the judgments of the Lord are truth: they are righteous altogether,
19.10: And more to be desired than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey, and the honeycomb.
19.11: Moreover by them is thy servant made circumspect, and in keeping of them there is great reward.
19.12: Who can understand his faults? cleanse me from secret faults.
19.13: Keep thy servant also from presumptuous sins: let them not reign over me: so shall I be upright, and made clean from much wickedness.
19.14: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of mine heart be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord my strength, and my redeemer.

20.1: The Lord hear thee in the day of trouble: the Name of the God of Jacob defend thee:
20.2: Send thee help from the Sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion.
20.3: Let him remember all thine offerings, and turn thy burnt offerings into ashes. Selah.
20.4: And grant thee according to thine heart, and fulfill all thy purpose:
20.5: That we may rejoice in thy salvation, and set up the banner in the Name of our God, when the Lord shall perform all thy petitions.
20.6: Now know I that the Lord will help his anointed, and will hear him from his Sanctuary, by the mighty help of his right hand.
20.7: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the Name of the Lord our God.
20.8: They are brought down and fallen, but we are risen, and stand upright.
20.9: Save Lord: Let the King hear us in the day that we call.

21.1: The King shall rejoice in thy strength, O Lord: yea how greatly shall he rejoice in thy salvation?
21.2: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not denied him the request of his lips. Selah.
21.3: For thou didst prevent him with liberal blessings, and didst set a crown of pure gold upon his head.
21.4: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest him a long life forever and ever.
21.5: His glory is great in thy salvation: dignity and honor hast thou laid upon him.
21.6: For thou hast set him as blessings forever: thou hast made him glad with the joy of thy countenance.
21.7: Because the king trusteth in the Lord, and in the mercy of the most high, he shall not slide.
21.8: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies, and thy right hand shall find out them that hate thee.
21.9: Thou shalt make them like a fiery oven in time of thine anger: the Lord shall destroy them in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
21.10: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from the children of men.
21.11: For they intended evil against thee, and imagined mischief, but they shall not prevail.
21.12: Therefore shalt thou put them apart, and the strings of thy bow shalt thou make ready against their faces.
21.13: Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.

22.1: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me, and art so far from mine health, and from the words of my roaring?
22.2: O my God, I cry by day, but thou hearest not: and by night, but have no audience.
22.3: But thou art holy, and dost inhabit the praises of Israel.
22.4: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
22.5: They called upon thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.
22.6: But I am a worm, and not a man: a shame of men, and the contempt of the people.
22.7: All they that see me, have me in derision: they make a mow and nod the head, saying,
22.8: He trusted in the Lord, let him deliver him: let him save him, seeing he loveth him.
22.9: But thou didst draw me out of the womb: thou gavest me hope, even at my mother’s breasts.
22.10: I was cast upon thee, even from the womb: thou art my God from my mother’s belly.
22.11: Be not far from me, because trouble is near: for there is none to help me.
22.12: Many young bulls have compassed me: mighty bulls of Bashan have closed me about.
22.13: They gape upon me with their mouths, as a ramping and roaring lion.
22.14: I am like water poured out, and all my bones are out of joint: mine heart is like wax: it is molten in the midst of my bowels.
22.15: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws, and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.
22.16: For dogs have compassed me, and the assembly of the wicked have enclosed me: they pierced mine hands and my feet.
22.17: I may tell all my bones, yet they behold, and look upon me.
22.18: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
22.19: But be not thou far off, O Lord, my strength: hasten to help me.
22.20: Deliver my soul from the sword: my desolate soul from the power of the dog.
22.21: Save me from the lion’s mouth, and answer me in saving me from the horns of the unicorns.
22.22: I will declare thy Name unto my brethren: in the midst of the Congregation will I praise thee, saying,
22.23: Praise the Lord, ye that fear him: magnify ye him, all the seed of Jacob, and fear ye him all the seed of Israel.
22.24: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the poor: neither hath he hid his face from him, but when he called unto him, he heard.
22.25: My praise shall be of thee in the great Congregation: my vows will I perform before them that fear him.
22.26: The poor shall eat and be satisfied: they that seek after the Lord, shall praise him: your heart shall live forever.
22.27: All the ends of the world shall remember themselves and turn to the Lord, and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.
22.28: For the kingdom is the Lord’s, and he ruleth among the nations.
22.29: All they that be fat in the earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down into the dust, shall bow before him, even he that cannot quicken his own soul.
22.30: Their seed shall serve him: it shall be counted unto the Lord for a generation.
22.31: They shall come and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, because he hath done it.

23.1: The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want.
23.2: He maketh me to rest in green pasture, and leadeth me by the still waters.
23.3: He restoreth my soul, and leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his Name’s sake.
23.4: Yea, though I should walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for thou art with me: thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me.
23.5: Thou dost prepare a table before me in the sight of mine adversaries: thou dost anoint mine head with oil, and my cup runneth over.
23.6: Doubtless kindness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I shall remain a long season in the house of the Lord.

24.1: The earth is the Lord’s, and all that therein is; the world and they that dwell therein.
24.2: For he hath founded it upon the seas; and established it upon the floods.
24.3: Who shall ascend into the mountain of the Lord? and who shall stand in his holy place?
24.4: Even he that hath innocent hands, and a pure heart; which hath not lifted up his mind unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
24.5: He shall receive a blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
24.6: This is the generation of them that seek him, of them that seek thy face, this is Jacob. Selah.
24.7: Lift up your heads ye gates, and be ye lifted up ye everlasting doors, and the King of glory shall come in.
24.8: Who is this King of glory? the Lord, strong and mighty, even the Lord mighty in battle.
24.9: Lift up your heads, ye gates, and lift up yourselves ye everlasting doors, and the King of glory shall come in.
24.10: Who is this King of glory? the Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.

25.1: Unto thee, O Lord, lift I up my soul.
25.2: My God, I trust in thee; let me not be confounded: let not mine enemies rejoice over me.
25.3: So all that hope in thee, shall not be ashamed; but let them be confounded, that transgress without cause.
25.4: Show me thy ways, O Lord, and teach me thy paths.
25.5: Lead me forth in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation: in thee do I trust all the day.
25.6: Remember, O Lord, thy tender mercies, and thy lovingkindness: for they have been forever.
25.7: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my rebellions, but according to thy kindness remember thou me, even for thy goodness sake, O Lord.
25.8: Gracious and righteous is the Lord: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
25.9: Them that be meek, will he guide in judgment, and teach the humble his way.
25.10: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies:
25.11: For thy Name’s sake, O Lord, be merciful unto mine iniquity, for it is great.
25.12: What man is he that feareth the Lord? him will he teach the way that he shall choose.
25.13: His soul shall dwell at ease, and his seed shall inherit the land.
25.14: The secret of the Lord is revealed to them that fear him: and his Covenant to give them understanding.
25.15: Mine eyes are ever toward the Lord: for he will bring my feet out of the net.
25.16: Turn thy face unto me, and have mercy upon me: for I am desolate and poor.
25.17: The sorrows of mine heart are enlarged: draw me out of my troubles.
25.18: Look upon mine affliction and my travail, and forgive all my sins.
25.19: Behold mine enemies, for they are many, and they hate me with cruel hatred.
25.20: Keep my soul and deliver me: let me not be confounded: for I trust in thee.
25.21: Let mine uprightness and equity preserve me; for mine hope is in thee.
25.22: Deliver Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.

26.1: Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in mine innocency: my trust hath been also in the Lord: therefore shall I not slide.
26.2: Prove me, O Lord, and try me: examine my reins, and mine heart.
26.3: For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes: therefore have I walked in thy truth.
26.4: I have not haunted with vain persons, neither kept company with the dissemblers.
26.5: I have hated the assembly of the evil, and have not companied with the wicked.
26.6: I will wash mine hands in innocency, O Lord, and compass thine altar,
26.7: That I may declare with the voice of thanksgiving, and set forth all thy wondrous works.
26.8: O Lord, I have loved the habitation of thine house, and the place where thine honor dwelleth.
26.9: Gather not my soul with the sinners, nor my life with the bloody men:
26.10: In whose hand is wickedness, and their right hand is full of bribes.
26.11: But I will walk in mine innocency: redeem me therefore, and be merciful unto me.
26.12: My foot standeth in uprightness: I will praise thee, O Lord, in the Congregations.

27.1: The Lord is my light and my salvation, whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life, of whom shall I be afraid?
27.2: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
27.3: Though an host pitched against me, mine heart should not be afraid: though war be raised against me, I will trust in this.
27.4: One thing have I desired of the Lord, that I will require, even that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord, and to visit his Temple.
27.5: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his Tabernacle: in the secret place of his pavilion shall he hide me, and set me up upon a rock.
27.6: And now shall he lift up mine head above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his Tabernacle sacrifices of joy: I will sing and praise the Lord.
27.7: Hearken unto my voice, O Lord, when I cry: have mercy also upon me and hear me.
27.8: When thou saidest, Seek ye my face, mine heart answered unto thee, O Lord, I will seek thy face.
27.9: Hide not therefore thy face from me, nor cast thy servant away in displeasure: thou hast been my succor, leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
27.10: Though my father and my mother should forsake me, yet the Lord will gather me up.
27.11: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and lead me in a right path, because of mine enemies.
27.12: Give me not unto the lust of mine adversaries: for there are false witnesses risen up against me, and such as speak cruelly.
27.13: I should have fainted, except I had believed to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
27.14: Hope in the Lord: be strong, and he shall comfort thine heart, and trust in the Lord.

28.1: Unto thee, O Lord, do I cry: O my strength, be not deaf toward me, lest if thou answer me not, I be like them that go down into the pit.
28.2: Hear the voice of my petitions, when I cry unto thee, when I hold up my hands toward thine holy Oracle.
28.3: Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity: which speak friendly to their neighbors, when malice is in their hearts.
28.4: Reward them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their inventions: recompense them after the work of their hands: render them their reward.
28.5: For they reward not the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands: therefore break them down, and build them not up.
28.6: Praised be the Lord, for he hath heard the voice of my petitions.
28.7: The Lord is my strength and my shield: mine heart trusted in him, and I was helped: therefore mine heart shall rejoice, and with my song will I praise him.
28.8: The Lord is their strength, and he is the strength of the deliverances of his anointed.
28.9: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and exalt them forever.

29.1: Give unto the Lord, ye sons of the mighty, give unto the Lord glory and strength.
29.2: Give unto the Lord glory due unto his Name: worship the Lord in the glorious Sanctuary.
29.3: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters: the God of glory maketh it to thunder: the Lord is upon the great waters.
29.4: The voice of the Lord is mighty: the voice of the Lord is glorious.
29.5: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars: yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.
29.6: He maketh them also to leap like a calf: Lebanon also and Shirion like a young unicorn.
29.7: The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire.
29.8: The voice of the Lord maketh the wilderness to tremble: the Lord maketh the wilderness of Kadesh to tremble.
29.9: The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests: therefore in his Temple doth every man speak of his glory.
29.10: The Lord sitteth upon the floods, and the Lord doth remain King forever.
29.11: The Lord shall give strength unto his people: the Lord shall bless his people with peace.

30.1: I will magnify thee, O Lord: thou hast exalted me, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
30.2: O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast restored me.
30.3: O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul out of the grave: thou hast revived me from them that go down into the pit.
30.4: Sing praises unto the Lord, ye his Saints, and give thanks before the remembrance of his Holiness.
30.5: For he endureth but a while in his anger: but in his favor is life: weeping may abide at evening, but joy cometh in the morning.
30.6: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
30.7: For thou Lord of thy goodness hadst made my mountain to stand strong: but thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
30.8: Then cried I unto thee, O Lord, and prayed to my Lord.
30.9: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit! shall the dust give thanks unto thee? or shall it declare thy truth?
30.10: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me: Lord, be thou mine helper.
30.11: Thou hast turned my mourning into joy: thou hast loosed my sack, and girded me with gladness.
30.12: Therefore shall my tongue praise thee and not cease: O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto thee forever.

31.1: In thee, O Lord, have I put my trust: let me never be confounded: deliver me in thy righteousness.
31.2: Bow down thine ear to me: make haste to deliver me: be unto me a strong rock, and an house of defense to save me.
31.3: For thou art my rock and my fortress: therefore for thy Name’s sake direct me and guide me.
31.4: Draw me out of the net, that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.
31.5: Into thine hand I commend my spirit: for thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.
31.6: I have hated them that give themselves to deceitful vanities: for I trust in the Lord.
31.7: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast seen my trouble: thou hast known my soul in adversities,
31.8: And thou hast not shut me up in the hand of the enemy, but hast set my feet at large.
31.9: Have mercy upon me, O Lord: for I am in trouble: mine eye, my soul and my belly are consumed with grief.
31.10: For my life is wasted with heaviness, and my years with mourning: my strength faileth for my pain, and my bones are consumed.
31.11: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but specially among my neighbors: and a fear to mine acquaintance, who seeing me in the street, fled from me.
31.12: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
31.13: For I have heard the railing of great men: fear was on every side, while they conspired together against me, and consulted to take my life.
31.14: But I trusted in thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my God.
31.15: My times are in thine hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
31.16: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: and save me through thy mercy.
31.17: Let me not be confounded, O Lord: for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be put to confusion, and to silence in the grave.
31.18: Let the lying lips be made dumb, which cruelly, proudly, and spitefully speak against the righteous.
31.19: How great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee! and done to them that trust in thee, even before the sons of men!
31.20: Thou dost hide them privily in thy presence from the pride of men: thou keepest them secretly in thy Tabernacle from the strife of tongues.
31.21: Blessed be the Lord: for he hath showed his marvelous kindness toward me in a strong city.
31.22: Though I said in mine haste, I am cast out of thy sight, yet thou heardest the voice of my prayer, when I cried unto thee.
31.23: Love ye the Lord all his Saints: for the Lord preserveth the faithful, and rewardeth abundantly the proud doer.
31.24: All ye that trust in the Lord, be strong, and he shall establish your heart.

32.1: Blessed is he whose wickedness is forgiven, and whose sin is covered.
32.2: Blessed is the man, unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.
32.3: When I held my tongue, my bones consumed, or when I roared all the day,
32.4: (For thine hand is heavy upon me day and night: and my moisture is turned into the drought of Summer. Selah.)
32.5: Then I acknowledged my sin unto thee, neither hid I mine iniquity: for I thought, I will confess against myself my wickedness unto the Lord, and thou forgavest the punishment of my sin. Selah.
32.6: Therefore shall everyone that is godly, make his prayer unto thee in a time, when thou mayest be found: surely in the flood of great waters they shall not come near him.
32.7: Thou art my secret place: thou preservest me from trouble: thou compassest me about with joyful deliverance. Selah.
32.8: I will instruct thee, and teach thee in the way that thou shalt go, and I will guide thee with mine eye.
32.9: Be ye not like an horse, or like a mule which understand not: whose mouths thou dost bind with bit and bridle, lest they come near thee.
32.10: Many sorrows shall come to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him.
32.11: Be glad ye righteous, and rejoice in the Lord, and be joyful all ye, that are upright in heart.

33.1: Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous: for it becometh upright men to be thankful.
33.2: Praise the Lord with harp: sing unto him with viol and instrument of ten strings.
33.3: Sing unto him a new song: sing cheerfully with a loud voice.
33.4: For the word of the Lord is righteous, and all his works are faithful.
33.5: He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
33.6: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
33.7: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as upon an heap, and layeth up the depths in his treasures.
33.8: Let all the earth fear the Lord: let all them that dwell in the world, fear him.
33.9: For he spake, and it was done: he commanded, and it stood.
33.10: The Lord breaketh the counsel of the heathen, and bringeth to nought the devices of the people.
33.11: The counsel of the Lord shall stand forever, and the thoughts of his heart throughout all ages.
33.12: Blessed is that nation, whose God is the Lord: even the people that he hath chosen for his inheritance.
33.13: The Lord looketh down from heaven, and beholdeth all the children of men.
33.14: From the habitation of his dwelling, he beholdeth all them that dwell in the earth.
33.15: He fashioneth their hearts every one, and understandeth all their works.
33.16: The King is not saved by the multitude of an host, neither is the mighty man delivered by great strength.
33.17: A horse is a vain help, and shall not deliver any by his great strength.
33.18: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him, and upon them that trust in his mercy,
33.19: To deliver their souls from death, and to preserve them in famine.
33.20: Our soul waiteth for the Lord: for he is our help and our shield.
33.21: Surely our heart shall rejoice in him, because we trusted in his holy Name.
33.22: Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, as we trusted in thee.

34.1: I will always give thanks unto the Lord: his praise shall be in my mouth continually.
34.2: My soul shall glory in the Lord: the humble shall hear it and be glad.
34.3: Praise ye the Lord with me, and let us magnify his Name together.
34.4: I sought the Lord, and he heard me: yea, he delivered me out of all my fear.
34.5: They shall look unto him, and run to him: and their faces shall not be ashamed, saying,
34.6: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
34.7: The Angel of the Lord pitched round about them, that fear him, and delivereth them.
34.8: Taste ye and see, how gracious the Lord is: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
34.9: Fear the Lord ye his Saints: for nothing wanteth to them that fear him.
34.10: The lions do lack and suffer hunger, but they which seek the Lord, shall want nothing that is good.
34.11: Come children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
34.12: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth long days for to see good?
34.13: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips, that they speak no guile.
34.14: Eschew evil and do good: seek peace and follow after it.
34.15: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
34.16: But the face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off their remembrance from the earth.
34.17: The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth them, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
34.18: The Lord is near unto them that are of a contrite heart, and will save such as be afflicted in spirit.
34.19: Great are the troubles of the righteous: but the Lord delivereth him out of them all.
34.20: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
34.21: But malice shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous, shall perish.
34.22: The Lord redeemeth the souls of his servants: and none that trust in him, shall perish.

35.1: Plead thou my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight thou against them that fight against me.
35.2: Lay hand upon the shield and buckler, and stand up for my help.
35.3: Bring out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me, say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
35.4: Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek after my soul: let them be turned back, and brought to confusion, that imagine mine hurt.
35.5: Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the Angel of the Lord scatter them.
35.6: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the Angel of the Lord persecute them.
35.7: For without cause they have hid the pit and their net for me: without cause have they dug a pit for my soul.
35.8: Let destruction come upon him at unawares, and let his net, that he hath laid privily, take him: let him fall into the same destruction.
35.9: Then my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
35.10: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him, that is too strong for him! yea, the poor and him that is in misery, from him that spoileth him!
35.11: Cruel witnesses did rise up: they asked of me things that I knew not.
35.12: They rewarded me evil for good, to have spoiled my soul.
35.13: Yet I, when they were sick, I was clothed with a sack: I humbled my soul with fasting: and my prayer was turned upon my bosom.
35.14: I behaved myself as to my friend, or as to my brother: I humbled myself, mourning as one that bewaileth his mother.
35.15: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: the abjects assembled themselves against me, and I knew not: they tare me, and ceased not,
35.16: With the false scoffers at banquets, gnashing their teeth against me.
35.17: Lord, how long wilt thou behold this? deliver my soul from their tumult, even my desolate soul from the lions.
35.18: So will I give thee thanks in a great Congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
35.19: Let not them that are mine enemies unjustly rejoice over me, neither let them wink with the eye, that hate me without a cause.
35.20: For they speak not as friends: but they imagine deceitful words against the quiet of the land.
35.21: And they gaped on me with their mouths, saying, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen.
35.22: Thou hast seen it, O Lord: keep not silence: be not far from me, O Lord.
35.23: Arise and wake to my judgment, even to my cause, my God, and my Lord.
35.24: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me.
35.25: Let them not say in their hearts, O our soul rejoice: neither let them say, We have devoured him.
35.26: Let them be confounded, and put to shame together, that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with confusion and shame, that lift up themselves against me.
35.27: But let them be joyful and glad, that love my righteousness: yea, let them say always, Let the Lord be magnified, which loveth the prosperity of his servant.
35.28: And my tongue shall utter thy righteousness, and thy praise every day.

36.1: Wickedness saith to the wicked man, even in mine heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
36.2: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, while his iniquity is found worthy to be hated.
36.3: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to understand and to do good.
36.4: He imagineth mischief upon his bed: he setteth himself upon a way, that is not good, and doth not abhor evil.
36.5: Thy mercy, O Lord, reacheth unto the heavens, and thy faithfulness unto the clouds.
36.6: Thy righteousness is like the mighty mountains: thy judgments are like a great deep: thou Lord, dost save man and beast.
36.7: How excellent is thy mercy, O God! therefore the children of men trust under the shadow of thy wings.
36.8: They shall be satisfied with the fatness of thine house, and thou shalt give them drink out of the river of thy pleasures.
36.9: For with thee is the well of life, and in thy light shall we see light.
36.10: Extend thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee, and thy righteousness unto them that are upright in heart.
36.11: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked men move me.
36.12: There they are fallen that work iniquity: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

37.1: Fret not thyself because of the wicked men, neither be envious for the evildoers.
37.2: For they shall soon be cut down like grass, and shall wither as the green herb.
37.3: Trust thou in the Lord and do good: dwell in the land, and thou shalt be fed assuredly:
37.4: And delight thyself in the Lord, and he shall give thee thine heart’s desire.
37.5: Commit thy way unto the Lord, and trust in him, and he shall bring it to pass.
37.6: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noon day.
37.7: Wait patiently upon the Lord, and hope in him: fret not thyself for him which prospereth in his way, nor for the man that bringeth his enterprises to pass.
37.8: Cease from anger, and leave off wrath: fret not thyself also to do evil.
37.9: For evildoers shall be cut off, and they that wait upon the Lord, they shall inherit the land.
37.10: Therefore yet a little while and the wicked shall not appear, and thou shalt look after his place, and he shall not be found.
37.11: But meek men shall possess the earth, and shall have their delight in the multitude of peace.
37.12: The wicked practiceth against the just, and gnasheth his teeth against him.
37.13: But the Lord shall laugh him to scorn: for he seeth that his day is coming.
37.14: The wicked have drawn their sword and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.
37.15: But their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
37.16: A small thing unto the just man is better than great riches to the wicked and mighty.
37.17: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the Lord upholdeth the just men.
37.18: The Lord knoweth the days of upright men, and their inheritance shall be perpetual.
37.19: They shall not be confounded in the perilous time, and in the days of famine they shall have enough.
37.20: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be consumed as the fat of lambs: even with the smoke shall they consume away.
37.21: The wicked borroweth and payeth not again: but the righteous is merciful and giveth.
37.22: For such as be blessed of God shall inherit the land, and they that be cursed of him, shall be cut off.
37.23: The paths of man are directed by the Lord: for he loveth his way.
37.24: Though he fall, he shall not be cast off, for the Lord putteth under his hand.
37.25: I have been young, and am old: yet I saw never the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.
37.26: But he is ever merciful and lendeth, and his seed enjoyeth the blessing.
37.27: Flee from evil and do good, and dwell forever.
37.28: For the Lord loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his Saints: they shall be preserved forevermore: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
37.29: The righteous men shall inherit the land, and dwell therein forever.
37.30: The mouth of the righteous will speak of wisdom, and his tongue will talk of judgment.
37.31: For the Law of his God is in his heart, and his steps shall not slide.
37.32: The wicked watched the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.
37.33: But the Lord will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him, when he is judged.
37.34: Wait thou on the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee, that thou shalt inherit the land: when the wicked men shall perish, thou shalt see.
37.35: I have seen the wicked strong, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.
37.36: Yet he passed away, and lo, he was gone, and I sought him, but he could not be found.
37.37: Mark the upright man, and behold the just: for the end of that man is peace.
37.38: But their transgressors shall be destroyed together, and the end of the wicked shall be cut off.
37.39: But the salvation of the righteous men shall be of the Lord: he shall be their strength in the time of trouble.
37.40: For the Lord shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and shall save them, because they trust in him.

38.1: O Lord, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chastise me in thy wrath.
38.2: For thine arrows have light upon me, and thine hand lieth upon me.
38.3: There is nothing sound in my flesh, because of thine anger: neither is there rest in my bones, because of my sin.
38.4: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head, and as a weighty burden they are too heavy for me.
38.5: My wounds are putrefied, and corrupt because of my foolishness.
38.6: I am bowed, and crooked very sore: I go mourning all the day.
38.7: For my reins are full of burning, and there is nothing sound in my flesh.
38.8: I am weakened and sore broken: I roar for the very grief of mine heart.
38.9: Lord, I pour my whole desire before thee, and my sighing is not hid from thee.
38.10: Mine heart panteth: my strength faileth me, and the light of mine eyes, even they are not mine own.
38.11: My lovers and my friends stand aside from my plague, and my kinsmen stand afar off.
38.12: They also that seek after my life, lay snares, and they that go about to do me evil, talk wicked things and imagine deceit continually.
38.13: But I as a deaf man heard not, and am as a dumb man, which openeth not his mouth.
38.14: Thus am I as a man, that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
38.15: For on thee, O Lord, do I wait: thou wilt hear me, my Lord, my God.
38.16: For I said, Hear me, lest they rejoice over me: for when my foot slippeth, they extol themselves against me.
38.17: Surely I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is ever before me.
38.18: When I declare my pain, and am sorry for my sin,
38.19: Then mine enemies are alive, and are mighty, and they that hate me wrongfully are many.
38.20: They also, that reward evil for good, are mine adversaries, because I follow goodness.
38.21: Forsake me not, O Lord, be not thou far from me, my God.
38.22: Haste thee, to help me, O my Lord, my salvation.

39.1: I thought, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth bridled, while the wicked is in my sight.
39.2: I was dumb and spake nothing: I kept silence even from good, and my sorrow was more stirred.
39.3: Mine heart was hot within me, and while I was musing, the fire kindled, and I spake with my tongue, saying,
39.4: Lord, let me know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is: let me know how long I have to live.
39.5: Behold, thou hast made my days as an hand breadth, and mine age as nothing in respect of thee: surely every man in his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
39.6: Doubtless man walketh in a shadow, and disquieteth himself in vain: he heapeth up riches, and cannot tell who shall gather them.
39.7: And now Lord, what wait I for? mine hope is even in thee.
39.8: Deliver me from all my transgressions, and make me not a rebuke unto the foolish.
39.9: I should have been dumb, and not have opened my mouth, because thou didst it.
39.10: Take thy plague away from me: for I am consumed by the stroke of thine hand.
39.11: When thou with rebukes dost chastise man for iniquity, thou as a moth makest his beauty to consume: surely every man is vanity. Selah.
39.12: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and hearken unto my cry: keep not silence at my tears, for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner as all my fathers.
39.13: Stay thine anger from me, that I may recover my strength, before I go hence and be not.

40.1: I waited patiently for the Lord, and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
40.2: He brought me also out of the horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon the rock, and ordered my goings.
40.3: And he hath put in my mouth a new song of praise unto our God: many shall see it and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.
40.4: Blessed is the man that maketh the Lord his trust, and regardeth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
40.5: O Lord my God, thou hast made thy wonderful works so many, that none can count in order to thee thy thoughts toward us: I would declare and speak of them, but they are more than I am able to express.
40.6: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire: (for mine ears hast thou prepared) burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
40.7: Then said I, Lo, I come: for in the roll of the book it is written of me.
40.8: I desired to do thy good will, O my God: yea, thy Law is within mine heart.
40.9: I have declared thy righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I will not refrain my lips: O Lord, thou knowest.
40.10: I have not hid thy righteousness within mine heart, but I have declared thy truth and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy mercy, and thy truth from the great Congregation.
40.11: Withdraw not thou thy tender mercy from me, O Lord, let thy mercy and thy truth always preserve me.
40.12: For innumerable troubles have compassed me: my sins have taken such hold upon me, that I am not able to look up: yea, they are more in number than the hairs of mine head: therefore mine heart hath failed me.
40.13: Let it please thee, O Lord, to deliver me: make haste, O Lord, to help me.
40.14: Let them be confounded and put to shame together, that seek my soul to destroy it: let them be driven backward and put to rebuke that desire mine hurt.
40.15: Let them be destroyed for a reward of their shame, which say unto me, Aha, aha.
40.16: Let all them that seek thee, rejoice and be glad in thee, and let them that love thy salvation, say always, The Lord be praised.
40.17: Though I be poor and needy, the Lord thinketh on me: thou art mine helper and my deliverer: my God, make no tarrying.

41.1: Blessed is he that judgeth wisely of the poor: the Lord shall deliver him in the time of trouble.
41.2: The Lord will keep him and preserve him alive, he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
41.3: The Lord will strengthen him upon the bed of sorrow: thou hast turned all his bed in his sickness.
41.4: Therefore I said, Lord have mercy upon me: heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.
41.5: Mine enemies speak evil of me, saying, When shall he die, and his name perish?
41.6: And if he come to see me, he speaketh lies, but his heart heapeth iniquity within him, and when he cometh forth, he telleth it.
41.7: All they that hate me whisper together against me: even against me do they imagine mine hurt.
41.8: A mischief is light upon him, and he that lieth, shall no more rise.
41.9: Yea, my familiar friend, whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up the heel against me.
41.10: Therefore, O Lord, have mercy upon me, and raise me up: so shall I reward them.
41.11: By this I know that thou favorest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph against me.
41.12: And as for me thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and dost set me before thy face forever.
41.13: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel world without end. So be it, even so be it.

42.1: As the Hart brayeth for the rivers of water, so panted my soul after thee, O God.
42.2: My soul thirsteth for God, even for the living God: when shall I come and appear before the presence of God?
42.3: Mine tears have been my meat day and night, while they daily say unto me, Where is thy God?
42.4: When I remembered these things, I poured out my very heart, because I had gone with the multitude, and led them into the house of God with the voice of singing, and praise, as a multitude that keepeth a feast.
42.5: Why art thou cast down, my soul, and unquiet within me? wait on God: for I will yet give him thanks for the help of his presence.
42.6: My God, my soul is cast down within me, because I remembered thee, from the land of Jordan, and Hermon, and from the mount Mizar.
42.7: One deep calleth another deep by the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy floods are gone over me.
42.8: The Lord will grant his loving-kindness in the day, and in the night shall I sing of him, even a prayer unto the God of my life.
42.9: I will say unto God, which is my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning, when the enemy oppresseth me?
42.10: My bones are cut asunder, while mine enemies reproach me, saying daily unto me, Where is thy God?
42.11: Why art thou cast down, my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? wait on God: for I will yet give him thanks: he is my present help and my God.

43.1: Judge me, O God, and defend my cause against the unmerciful people: deliver me from the deceitful and wicked man.
43.2: For thou art the God of my strength: why hast thou put me away? why go I so mourning, when the enemy oppressed me?
43.3: Send thy light and thy truth: let them lead me: let them bring me unto thine holy Mountain, and to thy Tabernacles.
43.4: Then will I go unto the altar of God, even unto the God of my joy and gladness: and upon the harp will I give thanks unto thee, O God my God.
43.5: Why art thou cast down, my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me: wait on God: for I will yet give him thanks, he is my present help and my God.

44.1: We have heard with our ears, O God: our fathers have told us the works that thou hast done in their days, in the old time:
44.2: How thou hast driven out the heathen with thine hand, and planted them: how thou hast destroyed the people, and caused them to grow.
44.3: For they inherited not the land by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou didst favor them.
44.4: Thou art my king, O God: send help unto Jacob.
44.5: Through thee have we thrust back our adversaries: by thy Name have we trodden down them that rose up against us.
44.6: For I do not trust in my bow, neither can my sword save me.
44.7: But thou hast saved us from our adversaries, and hast put them to confusion that hate us.
44.8: Therefore will we praise God continually, and will confess thy Name forever. Selah.
44.9: But now thou art far off, and puttest us to confusion, and goest not forth with our armies.
44.10: Thou makest us to turn back from the adversary, and they which hate us, spoil for themselves.
44.11: Thou givest us as sheep to be eaten, and dost scatter us among the nations.
44.12: Thou sellest thy people without gain, and dost not increase their price.
44.13: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbors, a jest and laughing stock to them that are round about us.
44.14: Thou makest us a proverb among the nations, and a nodding of the head among the people.
44.15: My confusion is daily before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
44.16: For the voice of the slanderer and rebuker, for the enemy and avenger.
44.17: All this is come upon us, yet do we not forget thee, neither deal we falsely concerning thy covenant.
44.18: Our heart is not turned back: neither our steps gone out of thy paths,
44.19: Albeit thou hast smitten us down into the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
44.20: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and held up our hands to a strange god,
44.21: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
44.22: Surely for thy sake are we slain continually, and are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
44.23: Up, why sleepest thou, O Lord? awake, be not far off forever.
44.24: Wherefore hidest thou thy face? and forgettest our misery and our affliction?
44.25: For our soul is beaten down unto the dust: our belly cleaveth to the ground.
44.26: Rise up for our succor, and redeem us for thy mercy’s sake.

45.1: Mine heart will utter forth a good matter: I will entreat in my works of the king: my tongue is as the pen of a swift writer.
45.2: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured in thy lips, because God hath blessed thee forever.
45.3: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, to wit, thy worship and thy glory:
45.4: And prosper with thy glory: ride upon the word of truth and of meekness and of righteousness: so thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
45.5: Thine arrows are sharp to pierce the heart of the King’s enemies: therefore the people shall fall under thee.
45.6: Thy throne, O God, is forever and ever: the scepter of thy kingdom, is a scepter of righteousness.
45.7: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness, because God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
45.8: All thy garments smell of myrrh and aloes, and cassia, when thou comest out of the ivory palaces where they have made thee glad.
45.9: King’s daughters were among thine honorable wives: upon thy right hand did stand the Queen in a vesture of gold of Ophir.
45.10: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear: forget also thine own people and thy father’s house.
45.11: So shall the King have pleasure in thy beauty: for he is thy Lord, and reverence thou him.
45.12: And the daughter of Tyre with the rich of the people, shall do homage before thy face with presents.
45.13: The King’s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of broidered gold.
45.14: She shall be brought unto the King in raiment of needlework: the virgins that follow after her, and her companions shall be brought unto thee.
45.15: With joy and gladness shall they be brought, and shall enter into the king’s palace.
45.16: Instead of thy fathers shall thy children be: thou shalt make them princes through all the earth.
45.17: I will make thy Name to be remembered through all generations: therefore shall the people give thanks unto thee, world without end.

46.1: God is our hope and strength, and help in troubles, ready to be found.
46.2: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be moved, and though the mountains fall into the midst of the sea,
46.3: Though the waters thereof rage and be troubled, and the mountains shake at the surges of the same. Selah.
46.4: Yet there is a River, whose stream shall make glad the City of God: even the Sanctuary of the Tabernacles of the most High.
46.5: God is in the midst of it: therefore shall it not be moved: God shall help it very early.
46.6: When the nations raged, and the kingdoms were moved, God thundered, and the earth melted.
46.7: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
46.8: Come and behold the works of the Lord, what desolations he hath made in the earth.
46.9: He maketh wars to cease unto the ends of the world, he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear, and burneth the chariots with fire.
46.10: Be still and know that I am God, I will be exalted among the heathen, and I will be exalted in the earth.
46.11: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

47.1: All people clap your hands; sing loud unto God with a joyful voice.
47.2: For the Lord is high, and terrible; a great King over all the earth.
47.3: He hath subdued the people under us, and the nations under our feet.
47.4: He hath chosen our inheritance for us: even the glory of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
47.5: God is gone up with triumph, even the Lord with the sound of the trumpet.
47.6: Sing praises to God, sing praises: sing praises unto our King, sing praises.
47.7: For God is the king of all the earth: sing praises everyone that hath understanding.
47.8: God reigneth over the heathen: God sitteth upon his holy Throne.
47.9: The princes of the people are gathered unto the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the world belong to God: he is greatly to be exalted.

48.1: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised in the City of our God, even upon his holy Mountain.
48.2: Mount Zion, lying Northward, is fair in situation: it is the joy of the whole earth, and the City of the great king.
48.3: In the palaces thereof God is known for a refuge.
48.4: For lo, the kings were gathered, and went together.
48.5: When they saw it, they marveled: they were astonied, and suddenly driven back.
48.6: Fear came there upon them, and sorrow, as upon a woman in travail.
48.7: As with an East wind thou breakest the ships of Tarshish, so were they destroyed.
48.8: As we have heard, so have we seen in the City of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it forever. Selah.
48.9: We wait for thy loving-kindness, O God, in the midst of thy Temple.
48.10: O God, according to thy Name, so is thy praise unto the world’s end: thy right hand is full of righteousness.
48.11: Let mount Zion rejoice, and the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.
48.12: Compass about Zion, and go round about it, and tell the towers thereof.
48.13: Mark well the wall thereof: behold her towers, that ye may tell your posterity.
48.14: For this God is our God forever and ever, he shall be our guide unto the death.

49.1: Hear this all ye people: give ear, all ye that dwell in the world,
49.2: As well low as high, both rich and poor.
49.3: My mouth shall speak of wisdom, and the meditation of mine heart is of knowledge.
49.4: I will incline mine ear to a parable, and utter my grave matter upon the harp.
49.5: Wherefore should I fear in the evil days, when iniquity shall compass me about, as at mine heels?
49.6: They trust in their goods, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.
49.7: Yet a man can by no means redeem his brother: he cannot give his ransom to God,
49.8: (So precious is the redemption of their souls, and the continuance forever)
49.9: That he may live still forever, and not see the grave.
49.10: For he seeth that wise men die: and also that the ignorant and foolish perish, and leave their riches for others.
49.11: Yet they think their houses and their habitations shall continue forever, even from generation to generation, and call their lands by their names.
49.12: But man shall not continue in honor; he is like the beasts that die.
49.13: This their way uttereth their foolishness; yet their posterity delight in their talk. Selah.
49.14: Like sheep they lie in grave; death devoureth them; and the righteous shall have domination over them in the morning; for their beauty shall consume, when they shall go from their house to grave.
49.15: But God shall deliver my soul from the power of the grave; for he will receive me. Selah.
49.16: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, and when the glory of his house is increased.
49.17: For he shall take nothing away, when he dieth, neither shall his pomp descend after him.
49.18: For while he lived, he rejoiced himself; and men will praise thee, when thou makest much of thyself.
49.19: He shall enter into the generation of his fathers, and they shall not live forever.
49.20: Man is in honor; and understandeth not; he is like to beasts that perish.

50.1: The God of gods, even the Lord hath spoken and called the earth from the rising up of the Sun, unto the going down thereof.
50.2: Out of Zion, which is the perfection of beauty, hath God shined.
50.3: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and a mighty tempest shall be moved round about him.
50.4: He shall call the heaven above, and the earth to judge his people.
50.5: Gather my Saints together unto me, those that make a covenant with me with sacrifice.
50.6: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is Judge himself. Selah.
50.7: Hear, O my people and I will speak: hear, O Israel, and I will testify unto thee: for I am God, even thy God.
50.8: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices, or thy burnt offerings, that have not been continually before me.
50.9: I will take no bullock out of thine house, nor goats out of thy folds.
50.10: For all the beasts of the forest are mine, and the beasts on a thousand mountains.
50.11: I know all the fowls on the mountains, and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
50.12: If I be hungry, I will not tell thee: for the world is mine and all that therein is.
50.13: Will I eat the flesh of bulls? or drink the blood of goats?
50.14: Offer unto God praise, and pay thy vows unto the most High,
50.15: And call upon me in the day of trouble: so will I deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
50.16: But unto the wicked said God, What hast thou to do to declare mine ordinances, that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth,
50.17: Seeing thou hatest to be reformed, and hast cast my words behind thee?
50.18: For when thou seest a thief, thou runnest with him, and thou art partaker with the adulterers.
50.19: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and with thy tongue thou forgest deceit.
50.20: Thou sittest, and speakest against thy brother, and slanderest thy mother’s son.
50.21: These things hast thou done, and I held my tongue: therefore thou thoughtest that I was like thee: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thee.
50.22: Oh consider this ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none that can deliver you.
50.23: He that offereth praise, shall glorify me: and to him that disposeth his way aright, will I show the salvation of God.

51.1: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy loving-kindness: according to the multitude of thy compassions put away mine iniquities.
51.2: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from mine sin.
51.3: For I know mine iniquities, and my sin is ever before me.
51.4: Against thee, against thee only have I sinned, and done evil in thy sight, that thou mayest be just when thou speakest, and pure when thou judgest.
51.5: Behold, I was born in iniquity, and in sin hath my mother conceived me.
51.6: Behold, thou lovest truth in the inward affections: therefore hast thou taught me wisdom in the secret of mine heart.
51.7: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
51.8: Make me to hear joy and gladness, that the bones, which thou hast broken, may rejoice.
51.9: Hide thy face from my sins, and put away all mine iniquities.
51.10: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
51.11: Cast me not away from thy presence, and take not thine holy Spirit from me.
51.12: Restore to me the joy of thy salvation, and establish me with thy free Spirit.
51.13: Then shall I teach thy ways unto the wicked, and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
51.14: Deliver me from blood, O God, which art the God of my salvation, and my tongue shall sing joyfully of thy righteousness.
51.15: Open thou my lips, O Lord, and my mouth shall show forth thy praise.
51.16: For thou desirest no sacrifice, though I would give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.
51.17: The sacrifices of God are a contrite spirit: a contrite and a broken heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
51.18: Be favorable unto Zion for thy good pleasure: build the walls of Jerusalem.
51.19: Then shalt thou accept the sacrifices of righteousness, even the burnt offering and oblation: then shall they offer calves upon thine altar.

52.1: Why boastest thou thyself in thy wickedness, O man of power? the loving-kindness of God endureth daily.
52.2: Thy tongue imagineth mischief, and is like a sharp razor, that cutteth deceitfully.
52.3: Thou dost love evil more than good, and lies more than to speak the truth. Selah.
52.4: Thou lovest all words that may destroy: O deceitful tongue!
52.5: So shall God destroy thee forever: he shall take thee and pluck thee out of thy tabernacle, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
