52.6: The righteous also shall see it, and fear, and shall laugh at him, saying,
52.7: Behold the man that took not God for his strength, but trusteth unto the multitude of his riches, and put his strength in his malice.
52.8: But I shall be like a green olive tree in the house of God: for I trusted in the mercy of God forever and ever.
52.9: I will always praise thee, for that thou hast done this, and I will hope in thy name, because it is good before thy Saints.

53.1: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God, they have corrupted and done abominable wickedness, there is none that doeth good.
53.2: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that would understand and seek God.
53.3: Everyone is gone back: they are altogether corrupt: there is none that doeth good, no not one.
53.4: Do not the workers of iniquity know that they eat up my people as they eat bread? they call not upon God.
53.5: There they were afraid for fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that besieged thee: thou hast put them to confusion, because God hath cast them off.
53.6: Oh give salvation unto Israel out of Zion: when God turneth the captivity of his people, then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

54.1: Save me, O God, by thy Name, and by thy power judge me.
54.2: O God, hear my prayer: hearken unto the words of my mouth.
54.3: For strangers are risen up against me, and tyrants seek my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.
54.4: Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.
54.5: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: Oh cut them off in thy truth!
54.6: Then I will sacrifice freely unto thee: I will praise thy Name, O Lord, because it is good.
54.7: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble, and mine eye hath seen my desire upon mine enemies.

55.1: Hear my prayer, O God, and hide not thyself from my supplication.
55.2: Hearken unto me, and answer me: I mourn in my prayer, and make a noise,
55.3: For the voice of the enemy, and for the vexation of the wicked, because they have brought iniquity upon me, and furiously hate me.
55.4: Mine heart trembleth within me, and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
55.5: Fear and trembling are come upon me, and an horrible fear hath covered me.
55.6: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove: then would I fly away and rest.
55.7: Behold I would take my flight far off, and lodge in the wilderness. Selah.
55.8: He would make haste for my deliverance from the stormy wind and tempest.
55.9: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen cruelty and strife in the city.
55.10: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof, both iniquity and mischief are in the midst of it.
55.11: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
55.12: Surely mine enemy did not defame me, for I could have borne it: neither did mine adversary exalt himself against me: for I would have hid me from him.
55.13: But it was thou, O man, even my companion, my guide, and my familiar:
55.14: Which delighted in consulting together, and went into the house of God as companions.
55.15: Let death seize upon them: let them go down quick into the grave: for wickedness is in their dwellings even in the midst of them.
55.16: But I will call unto God, and the Lord will save me.
55.17: Evening and morning, and at noon will I pray and make a noise, and he will hear my voice.
55.18: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for many were with me.
55.19: God shall hear and afflict them, even he that reigneth of old, Selah: because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
55.20: He laid his hand upon such as be at peace with him, and he brake his covenant.
55.21: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, yet war was in his heart, his words were more gentle than oil, yet they were swords.
55.22: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall nourish thee: he will not suffer the righteous to fall forever.
55.23: And thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of corruption: the bloody, and deceitful men shall not live half their days: but I will trust in thee.

56.1: Be merciful unto me, O God, for man would swallow me up: he fighteth continually and vexeth me.
56.2: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for many fight against me, O thou most High.
56.3: When I was afraid, I trusted in thee.
56.4: I will rejoice in God, because of his word, I trust in God, and will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
56.5: Mine own words grieve me daily: all their thoughts are against me to do me hurt.
56.6: They gather together, and keep themselves close: they mark my steps, because they wait for my soul.
56.7: They think they shall escape by iniquity: O God, cast these people down in thine anger.
56.8: Thou hast counted my wanderings; put my tears into thy bottle; are they not in thy register?
56.9: When I cry, then mine enemies shall turn back; this I know, for God is with me.
56.10: I will rejoice in God because of his word; in the Lord will I rejoice because of his word.
56.11: In God do I trust; I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.
56.12: Thy vows are upon me, O God, I will render praises unto thee.
56.13: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, and also my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

57.1: Have mercy upon me, O God, have mercy upon me; for my soul trusteth in thee, and in the shadow of thy wings will I trust, till these afflictions overpass.
57.2: I will call unto the most high God, even the God, that performeth his promise toward me.
57.3: He will send from heaven, and save me from the reproof of him that would swallow me. Selah. God will send his mercy, and his truth.
57.4: My soul is among lions; I lie among the children of men, that are set on fire; whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
57.5: Exalt thyself, O God, above the heaven, and let thy glory be upon all the earth.
57.6: They have laid a net for my steps; my soul is pressed down, they have dug a pit before me, and are fallen into the midst of it. Selah.
57.7: Mine heart is prepared, O God, mine heart is prepared; I will sing and give praise.
57.8: Awake my tongue, awake viol and harp: I will awake early.
57.9: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people, and I will sing unto thee among the nations.
57.10: For thy mercy is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.
57.11: Exalt thyself, O God, above the heavens, and let thy glory be upon all the earth.

58.1: Is it true? O congregation, speak ye justly? O sons of men judge ye uprightly?
58.2: Yea, rather ye imagine mischief in your heart: your hands execute cruelty upon the earth.
58.3: The wicked are strangers from the womb: even from the belly have they erred, and speak lies.
58.4: Their poison is even like the poison of a serpent; like the deaf adder that stoppeth his ear.
58.5: Which heareth not the voice of the enchanter, though he be most expert in charming.
58.6: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths: break the jaws of the young lions, O Lord.
58.7: Let them melt like the waters, let them pass away; when he shooteth his arrows, let them be as broken.
58.8: Let them consume like a snail that melteth, and like the untimely fruit of a woman, that hath not seen the sun.
58.9: As raw flesh before your pots feel the fire of thorns: so let them carry them away as with a whirlwind in his wrath.
58.10: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
58.11: And men shall say, Verily there is fruit for the righteous; doubtless there is a God that judgeth in the earth.

59.1: O my God, deliver me from mine enemies; defend me from them that rise up against me.
59.2: Deliver me from the wicked doers, and save me from the bloody men.
59.3: For lo, they have laid wait for my soul; the mighty men are gathered against me, not for mine offense, nor for my sin, O Lord.
59.4: They run and prepare themselves without a fault on my part: arise therefore to assist me, and behold.
59.5: Even thou, O Lord God of hosts, O God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen, and be not merciful unto all that transgress maliciously. Selah.
59.6: They go to and fro in the evening: they bark like dogs, and go about the city.
59.7: Behold, they brag in their talk, and swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
59.8: But thou, O Lord, shalt have them in derision, and thou shalt laugh at all the heathen.
59.9: He is strong: but I will wait upon thee: for God is my defense.
59.10: My merciful God will prevent me: God will let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
59.11: Slay them not, lest my people forget it: but scatter them abroad by thy power, and put them down, O Lord, our shield,
59.12: For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips: and let them be taken in their pride, even for their perjury and lies, that they speak.
59.13: Consume them in thy wrath: consume them that they be no more: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob, even unto the ends of the world. Selah.
59.14: And in the evening they shall go to and fro, and bark like dogs, and go about the city.
59.15: They shall run here and there for meat, and surely they shall not be satisfied, though they tarry all night.
59.16: But I will sing of thy power, and will praise thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.
59.17: Unto thee, O my Strength will I sing: for God is my defense, and my merciful God.

60.1: O God, thou hast cast us out, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been angry, turn again unto us.
60.2: Thou hast made the land to tremble, and hast made it to gape: heal the breaches thereof, for it is shaken.
60.3: Thou hast showed thy people heavy things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of giddiness.
60.4: But now thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of thy truth. Selah.
60.5: That thy beloved may be delivered, help with thy right hand and hear me.
60.6: God hath spoken in his holiness: therefore I will rejoice: I shall divide Shechem, and measure the valley of Succoth.
60.7: Gilead shall be mine, and Manasseh shall be mine: Ephraim also shall be the strength of mine head: Judah is my lawgiver.
60.8: Moab shall be my washpot: over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia show thyself joyful for me.
60.9: Who will lead me into the strong city? who will bring me unto Edom?
60.10: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off, and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?
60.11: Give us help against trouble: for vain is the help of man.
60.12: Through God we shall do valiantly; for he shall tread down our enemies.

61.1: Hear my cry, O God: give ear unto my prayer.
61.2: From the ends of the earth will I cry unto thee: when mine heart is oppressed, bring me upon the rock that is higher than I.
61.3: For thou hast been my hope, and a strong tower against the enemy.
61.4: I will dwell in thy Tabernacle forever, and my trust shall be under the covering of thy wings. Selah.
61.5: For thou, O God, hast heard my desires; thou hast given an heritage unto those that fear thy Name.
61.6: Thou shalt give the King a long life; his years shall be as many ages.
61.7: He shall dwell before God forever; prepare mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.
61.8: So will I always sing praise unto thy Name, in performing daily my vows.

62.1: Yet my soul keepeth silence unto God; of him cometh my salvation.
62.2: Yet he is my strength and my salvation, and my defense; therefore I shall not much be moved.
62.3: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be all slain; ye shall be as a bowed wall, or as a wall shaken.
62.4: Yet they consult to cast him down from his dignity; their delight is in lies: they bless with their mouths, but curse with their hearts. Selah.
62.5: Yet my soul, keep thou silence unto God: for mine hope is in him.
62.6: Yet is he my strength and my salvation, and my defense: therefore I shall not be moved.
62.7: In God is my salvation and my glory, the rock of my strength; in God is my trust.
62.8: Trust in him always, ye people; pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope. Selah.
62.9: Yet the children of men are vanity, the chief men are liars: to lay them upon a balance they are altogether lighter than vanity.
62.10: Trust not in oppression nor in robbery: be not vain: if riches increase, set not your heart thereon.
62.11: God spake once or twice, I have heard it, that power belongeth unto God,
62.12: And to thee, O Lord, mercy: for thou rewardest everyone according to his work.

63.1: O God, thou art my God, early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee: my flesh longeth greatly after thee in a barren and dry land without water:
63.2: Thus I behold thee as in the Sanctuary, when I behold thy power and thy glory.
63.3: For thy loving-kindness is better than life: therefore my lips shall praise thee.
63.4: Thus will I magnify thee all my life, and lift up mine hands in thy Name.
63.5: My soul shall be satisfied, as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips,
63.6: When I remember thee on my bed, and when I think upon thee in the night watches.
63.7: Because thou hast been mine helper, therefore under the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
63.8: My soul cleaveth unto thee: for thy right hand upholdeth me.
63.9: Therefore they that seek my soul to destroy it, they shall go into the lowest parts of the earth.
63.10: They shall cast him down with the edge of the sword, and they shall be a portion for foxes.
63.11: But the king shall rejoice in God, and all that swear by him shall rejoice in him: for the mouth of them that speak lies, shall be stopped.

64.1: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
64.2: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, and from the rage of the works of iniquity.
64.3: Which have whet their tongue like a sword, and shot for their arrows bitter words:
64.4: To shoot at the upright in secret: they shoot at him suddenly and fear not.
64.5: They encourage themselves in a wicked purpose: they commune together to lay snares privily, and say, Who shall see them?
64.6: They have sought out iniquities, and have accomplished that which they sought out, even everyone his secret thoughts, and the depth of his heart.
64.7: But God will shoot an arrow at them suddenly: their strokes shall be at once.
64.8: They shall cause their own tongue to fall upon them: and whosoever shall see them, shall flee away.
64.9: And all men shall see it, and declare the work of God, and they shall understand, what he hath wrought.
64.10: But the righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and trust in him: and all that are upright of heart, shall rejoice.

65.1: O God, praise waiteth for thee in Zion, and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
65.2: Because thou hearest the prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
65.3: Wicked deeds have prevailed against me: but thou wilt be merciful unto our transgressions.
65.4: Blessed is he, whom thou choosest and causest to come to thee: he shall dwell in thy courts, and we shall be satisfied with the pleasures of thine House, even of thine holy Temple.
65.5: O God of our salvation, thou wilt answer us with fearful signs in thy righteousness, O thou the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are far off in the Sea.
65.6: He establisheth the mountains by his power: and is girded about with strength.
65.7: He appeaseth the noise of the seas, and the noise of the waves thereof, and the tumults of the people.
65.8: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth, shall be afraid of thy signs; thou shalt make the East and the West to rejoice.
65.9: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it; thou makest it very rich: the river of God is full of water, thou preparest them corn; for so thou appointest it.
65.10: Thou waterest abundantly the furrows thereof; thou causest the rain to descend into the valleys thereof; thou makest it soft with showers, and blessest the bud thereof.
65.11: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness, and thy steps drop fatness.
65.12: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the hills shall be compassed with gladness.
65.13: The pastures are clad with sheep; the valleys also shall be covered with corn; therefore they shout for joy, and sing.

66.1: Rejoice in God, all ye inhabitants of the earth.
66.2: Sing forth the glory of his Name: make his praise glorious.
66.3: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies be in subjection unto thee.
66.4: All the world shall worship thee, and sing unto thee, even sing of thy Name. Selah.
66.5: Come and behold the works of God: he is terrible in his doings toward the sons of men.
66.6: He hath turned the sea into dry land: they passed through the river on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
66.7: He ruleth the world with his power: his eyes behold the nations: the rebellious shall not exalt themselves. Selah.
66.8: Praise our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard.
66.9: Which holdeth our souls in life, and suffereth not our feet to slip.
66.10: For thou, O God, hast proved us, thou hast tried us as silver is tried.
66.11: Thou hast brought us unto the snare, and laid a strait chain upon our loins.
66.12: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads: we went into fire and into water, but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
66.13: I will go into thine House with burnt offerings, and will pay thee my vows,
66.14: Which my lips have promised, and my mouth hath spoken in mine affliction.
66.15: I will offer unto thee the burnt offerings of fat rams with incense: I will prepare bullocks and goats. Selah.
66.16: Come and hearken, all ye that fear God, and I will tell you what he hath done to my soul.
66.17: I called unto him with my mouth, and he was exalted with my tongue.
66.18: If I regard wickedness in mine heart, the Lord will not hear me.
66.19: But God hath heard me, and considered the voice of my prayer.
66.20: Praised be God, which hath not put back my prayer, nor his mercy from me.

67.1: God be merciful unto us, and bless us, and cause his face to shine among us. (Selah.)
67.2: That they may know thy way upon earth, and thy saving health among all nations.
67.3: Let the people praise thee, O God: let all the people praise thee.
67.4: Let the people be glad and rejoice: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon the earth. Selah.
67.5: Let the people praise thee, O God: let all the people praise thee.
67.6: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase, and God, even our God shall bless us.
67.7: God shall bless us, and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.

68.1: God will arise, and his enemies shall be scattered: they also that hate him, shall flee before him.
68.2: As the smoke vanisheth, so shalt thou drive them away: and as wax melteth before the fire, so shall the wicked perish at the presence of God.
68.3: But the righteous shall be glad, and rejoice before God: yea, they shall leap for joy.
68.4: Sing unto God, and sing praises unto his name: exalt him that rideth upon the heavens, in his Name Jah, and rejoice before him.
68.5: He is a Father of the fatherless, and a Judge of the widows, even God in his holy habitation.
68.6: God maketh the solitary to dwell in families, and delivereth them that were prisoners in stocks: but the rebellious shall dwell in a dry land.
68.7: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people: when thou wentest through the wilderness, (Selah.)
68.8: The earth shook, and the heavens dropped at the presence of this God: even Sinai was moved at the presence of God, even the God of Israel.
68.9: Thou, O God, sentest a gracious rain upon thine inheritance, and thou didst refresh it when it was weary.
68.10: Thy Congregation dwelled therein: for thou, O God, hast of thy goodness prepared it for the poor.
68.11: The Lord gave matter to the women to tell of the great army.
68.12: Kings of the armies did flee: they did flee, and she that remained in the house, divided the spoil.
68.13: Though ye have lain among pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove that is covered with silver, and whose feathers are like yellow gold.
68.14: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as the snow in Zalmon.
68.15: The mountain of God is like the mountain of Bashan: it is an high mountain, as mount Bashan.
68.16: Why leap ye, ye high mountains? as for this Mountain, God delighteth to dwell in it: yea, the Lord will dwell in it forever.
68.17: The chariots of God are twenty thousand thousand Angels, and the Lord is among them, as in the Sanctuary of Sinai.
68.18: Thou art gone up on high: thou hast led captivity captive, and received gifts for men: yea, even the rebellious hast thou led, that the Lord God might dwell there.
68.19: Praised be the Lord, even the God of our salvation, which ladeth us daily with benefits. Selah.
68.20: This is our God, even the God that saveth us: and to the Lord God belong the issues of death.
68.21: Surely God will wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy pate of him that walketh in his sins.
68.22: The Lord hath said, I will bring my people again from Bashan: I will bring them again from the depths of the Sea:
68.23: That thy foot may be dipped in blood, and the tongue of thy dogs in the blood of the enemies, even in it.
68.24: They have seen, O God, thy goings, the goings of my God, and my king, which art in the Sanctuary.
68.25: The singers went before, the players of instruments after: in the midst were the maids playing with timbrels.
68.26: Praise ye God in the assemblies, and the Lord, ye that are of the fountain of Israel.
68.27: There was little Benjamin with their ruler, and the Princes of Judah with their assembly, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
68.28: Thy GOD hath appointed thy strength: establish, O God, that which thou first wrought in us,
68.29: Out of thy Temple upon Jerusalem, and kings shall bring presents unto thee.
68.30: Destroy the company of the spearmen, and multitude of the mighty bulls with the calves of the people, that tread under feet pieces of silver: scatter the people that delight in war.
68.31: Then shall the princes come out of Egypt: Ethiopia shall haste to stretch her hands unto God.
68.32: Sing unto God, O ye kingdoms of the earth: sing praise unto the Lord, (Selah)
68.33: To him that rideth upon the most high heavens, which were from the beginning: behold, he will send out by his voice a mighty sound.
68.34: Ascribe the power to God: for his majesty is upon Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
68.35: O God, thou art terrible out of thine holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto the people: praised be God.

69.1: Save me, O God: for the waters are entered even to my soul.
69.2: I stick fast in the deep mire, where no stay is: I am come into deep waters, and the streams run over me.
69.3: I am weary of crying: my throat is dry: mine eyes fail, while I wait for my God.
69.4: They that hate me without a cause, are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, and are mine enemies falsely, are mighty, so that I restored that which I took not.
69.5: O God, thou knowest my foolishness, and my faults are not hid from thee.
69.6: Let not them that trust in thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for me: let not those that seek thee, be confounded through me, O God of Israel.
69.7: For thy sake have I suffered reproof: shame hath covered my face.
69.8: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, even an alien unto my mother’s sons.
69.9: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me, and the rebukes of them that rebuked thee, are fallen upon me.
69.10: I wept and my soul fasted, but that was to my reproof.
69.11: I put on a sack also: and I became a proverb unto them.
69.12: They that sat in the gate, spake of me, and the drunkards sang of me.
69.13: But Lord, I make my prayer unto thee in an acceptable time, even in the multitude of thy mercy: O God, hear me in the truth of thy salvation.
69.14: Deliver me out of the mire, that I sink not: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
69.15: Let not the water flood drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
69.16: Hear me, O Lord, for thy loving-kindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
69.17: And hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in trouble; make haste and hear me.
69.18: Draw near unto my soul and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.
69.19: Thou hast known my reproof and my shame, and my dishonor: all mine adversaries are before thee.
69.20: Rebuke hath broken mine heart, and I am full of heaviness, and I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was none: and for comforters, but I found none.
69.21: For they gave me gall in my meat, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
69.22: Let their table be a snare before them, and their prosperity their ruin.
69.23: Let their eyes be blinded that they see not: and make their loins always to tremble.
69.24: Pour out thine anger upon them, and let thy wrathful displeasure take them.
69.25: Let their habitation be void, and let none dwell in their tents.
69.26: For they persecute him, whom thou hast smitten: and they add unto the sorrow of them, whom thou hast wounded.
69.27: Lay iniquity upon their iniquity, and let them not come into thy righteousness.
69.28: Let them be put out of the book of life, neither let them be written with the righteous.
69.29: When I am poor and in heaviness, thine help, O God, shall exalt me.
69.30: I will praise the Name of God with a song, and magnify him with thanksgiving.
69.31: This also shall please the Lord better than a young bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
69.32: The humble shall see this, and they that seek God shall be glad, and your heart shall live.
69.33: For the Lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
69.34: Let heaven and earth praise him: the seas and all that moveth in them.
69.35: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah, that men may dwell there and have it in possession.
69.36: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

70.1: O God, haste thee to deliver me: make haste to help me, O Lord.
70.2: Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek my soul: let them be turned backward and put to rebuke, that desire mine hurt.
70.3: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame, which say, Aha, aha.
70.4: But let all those that seek thee, be joyful and glad in thee, and let all that love thy salvation, say always, God be praised.
70.5: Now I am poor and needy: O God, make haste to me: thou art my helper, and my deliverer: O Lord, make no tarrying.

71.1: In thee, O Lord, I trust: let me never be ashamed.
71.2: Rescue me and deliver me in thy righteousness: incline thine ear unto me and save me.
71.3: Be thou my strong rock, whereunto I may always resort: thou hast given commandment to save me: for thou art my rock, and my fortress.
71.4: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked: out of the hand of the evil and cruel man.
71.5: For thou art mine hope, O Lord God, even my trust from my youth.
71.6: Upon thee have I been stayed from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise shall be always of thee.
71.7: I am become as it were a monster unto many: but thou art my sure trust.
71.8: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise, and with thy glory every day.
71.9: Cast me not off in the time of age: forsake me not when my strength faileth.
71.10: For mine enemies speak of me, and they that lay wait for my soul, take their counsel together,
71.11: Saying, God hath forsaken him: pursue and take him, for there is none to deliver him.
71.12: Go not far from me, O God: my God haste thee to help me.
71.13: Let them be confounded and consumed that are against my soul: let them be covered with reproof and confusion, that seek mine hurt.
71.14: But I will wait continually, and will praise thee more and more.
71.15: My mouth shall daily rehearse thy righteousness, and thy salvation: for I know not the number.
71.16: I will go forward in the strength of the Lord God, and will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
71.17: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth even until now: therefore will I tell of thy wondrous works,
71.18: Yea even unto mine old age and gray head, O God: forsake me not, until I have declared thine arm unto this generation, and thy power to all them that shall come.
71.19: And thy righteousness, O God, I will exalt on high: for thou hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!
71.20: Which hast showed me great troubles and adversities, but thou wilt return and revive me, and wilt come again, and take me up from the depth of the earth.
71.21: Thou wilt increase mine honor, and return and comfort me.
71.22: Therefore will I praise thee for thy faithfulness, O God, upon instrument and viol: unto thee will I sing upon the harp, O Holy one of Israel.
71.23: My lips will rejoice when I sing unto thee, and my soul which thou hast delivered.
71.24: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness daily: for they are confounded and brought unto shame, that seek mine hurt.

72.1: Give thy judgments to the King, O God, and thy righteousness to the King’s son.
72.2: Then shall he judge thy people in righteousness, and thy poor with equity.
72.3: The mountains, and the hills shall bring peace to the people by justice.
72.4: He shall judge the poor of the people: he shall save the children of the needy, and shall subdue the oppressor.
72.5: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endureth, from generation to generation.
72.6: He shall come down like the rain upon the mown grass, and as the showers that water the earth.
72.7: In his days shall the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace shall be so long as the moon endureth.
72.8: His dominion shall be also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the land.
72.9: They that dwell in the wilderness, shall kneel before him, and his enemies shall lick the dust.
72.10: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall bring gifts.
72.11: Yea, all kings shall worship him: all nations shall serve him.
72.12: For he shall deliver the poor when he crieth: the needy also, and him that hath no helper.
72.13: He shall be merciful to the poor and needy, and shall preserve the souls of the poor.
72.14: He shall redeem their souls from deceit and violence, and dear shall their blood be in his sight.
72.15: Yea, he shall live, and unto him shall they give of the gold of Sheba: they shall also pray for him continually, and daily bless him.
72.16: An handful of corn shall be sown in the earth, even in the top of the mountains, and the fruit thereof shalt shake like the trees of Lebanon: and the children shall flourish out of the city like the grass of the earth.
72.17: His name shall be forever: his name shall endure as long as the Sun: all nations shall bless him, and be blessed in him.
72.18: Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel which only doeth wondrous things.
72.19: And blessed be his glorious Name forever: and let all the earth be filled with his glory. So be it, even so be it.
72.20: Here end the prayers of David the son of Jesse.

73.1: Yet God is good to Israel: even to the pure in heart.
73.2: As for me, my feet were almost gone: my steps had well near slipped.
73.3: For I fretted at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
73.4: For there are no bands in their death, but they are lusty and strong.
73.5: They are not in trouble as other men, neither are they plagued with other men.
73.6: Therefore pride is as a chain unto them, and cruelty covereth them as a garment.
73.7: Their eyes stand out for fatness: they have more than heart can wish.
73.8: They are licentious, and speak wickedly of their oppression: they talk presumptuously.
73.9: They set their mouth against heaven, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
73.10: Therefore his people turn hither: for waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
73.11: And they say, How doth God know it? or is there knowledge in the most High?
73.12: Lo these are the wicked, yet prosper they always, and increase in riches.
73.13: Certainly I have cleansed mine heart in vain, and washed mine hands in innocency.
73.14: For daily have I been punished, and chastened every morning.
73.15: If I say, I will judge thus, behold the generation of thy children, I have trespassed.
73.16: Then thought I to know this, but it was too painful for me,
73.17: Until I went into the Sanctuary of God: then understood I their end.
73.18: Surely thou hast set them in slippery places, and castest them down into desolation.
73.19: How suddenly are they destroyed, perished and horribly consumed,
73.20: As a dream when one awaketh! O Lord, when thou raisest us up, thou shalt make their image despised.
73.21: Certainly mine heart was vexed, and I was pricked in my reins.
73.22: So foolish was I and ignorant: I was a beast before thee.
73.23: Yet I was always with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
73.24: Thou wilt guide me by thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
73.25: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and I have desired none in the earth with thee.
73.26: My flesh faileth and mine heart also: but God is the strength of mine heart, and my portion forever.
73.27: For lo, that they withdraw themselves from thee, shall perish: thou destroyest all them that go a whoring from thee.
73.28: As for me, it is good for me to draw near to God: therefore I have put my trust in the Lord God, that I may declare all thy works.

74.1: O God, why hast thou put us away forever? why is thy wrath kindled against the sheep of thy pasture?
74.2: Think upon the congregation, which thou hast possessed of old, and on the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed, and on this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
74.3: Lift up thy strokes, that thou mayest forever destroy every enemy that doeth evil to the Sanctuary.
74.4: Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy congregation, and set up their banners for signs.
74.5: He that lifted the axes upon the thick trees, was renowned as one that brought a thing to perfection:
74.6: But now they break down the carved work thereof with axes and hammers.
74.7: They have cast thy Sanctuary into the fire, and razed it to the ground, and have defiled the dwelling place of thy Name.
74.8: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them altogether: they have burnt all the Synagogues of God in the land.
74.9: We see not our signs: there is not one Prophet more, nor any with us that knoweth how long.
74.10: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach thee? shall the enemy blaspheme thy Name forever?
74.11: Why withdrawest thou thine hand, even thy right hand? draw it out of thy bosom, and consume them.
74.12: Even God is my king of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
74.13: Thou didst divide the sea by thy power: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
74.14: Thou brakest the head of Leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat for the people in wilderness.
74.15: Thou brakest up the fountain and river: thou driest up mighty rivers.
74.16: The day is thine, and the night is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
74.17: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made Summer and Winter.
74.18: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached the Lord, and the foolish people hath blasphemed thy Name.
74.19: Give not the soul of thy turtle dove unto the beast, and forget not the Congregation of thy poor forever.
74.20: Consider thy covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of the cruel.
74.21: O let not the oppressed return ashamed, but let the poor and needy praise thy Name.
74.22: Arise, O God: maintain thy own cause: remember thy daily reproach by the foolish man.
74.23: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: for the tumult of them that rise against thee, ascendeth continually.

75.1: We will praise thee, O God, we will praise thee, for thy Name is near: therefore they will declare thy wondrous works.
75.2: When I shall take a convenient time, I will judge righteously.
75.3: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: but I will establish the pillars of it. Selah.
75.4: I said unto the foolish, Be not so foolish, and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn.
75.5: Lift not up your horn on high, neither speak with a stiff neck.
75.6: For to come to preferment is neither from the East, nor from the West, nor from the South,
75.7: But God is the judge: he maketh low, and he maketh high.
75.8: For in the hand of the Lord is a cup, and the wine is red: it is full mixed, and he poureth out of the same: surely all the wicked of the earth shall wring out and drink the dregs thereof.
75.9: But I will declare forever, and sing praises unto the God of Jacob.
75.10: All the horns of the wicked also will I break: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

76.1: God is known in Judah: his Name is great in Israel.
76.2: For in Salem is his Tabernacle, and his dwelling in Zion.
76.3: There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.
76.4: Thou art more bright and puissant, than the mountains of prey.
76.5: The stouthearted are spoiled: they have slept their sleep, and all the men of strength have not found their hands.
76.6: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast asleep.
76.7: Thou, even thou art to be feared; and who shall stand in thy sight, when thou art angry!
76.8: Thou didst cause thy judgment to be heard from heaven; therefore the earth feared, and was still,
76.9: When thou, O God, arose to judgment, to help all the meek of the earth. Selah.
76.10: Surely the rage of man shall turn to thy praise; the remnant of the rage shalt thou restrain.
76.11: Vow and perform unto the Lord your God, all ye that be round about him; let them bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.
76.12: He shall cut off the spirit of princes; he is terrible to the kings of the earth.

77.1: My voice came to God, when I cried: my voice came to God; and he heard me.
77.2: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran and ceased not in the night: my soul refused comfort.
77.3: I did think upon God, and was troubled: I prayed, and my spirit was full of anguish. Selah.
77.4: Thou keepest mine eyes waking: I was astonied, and could not speak.
77.5: Then I considered the days of old: and the years of ancient time.
77.6: I called to remembrance my song in the night: I communed with mine own heart, and my spirit searched diligently.
77.7: Will the Lord absent himself forever? and will he show no more favor?
77.8: Is his mercy clean gone forever? doth his promise fail forevermore?
77.9: Hath God forgotten to be merciful? hath he shut up his tender mercies in displeasure? Selah.
77.10: And I said, This is my death: yet I remembered the years of the right hand of the most High.
77.11: I remembered the works of the Lord: certainly I remembered thy wonders of old.
77.12: I did also meditate all thy works, and did devise of thine acts, saying,
77.13: Thy way, O God, is in the Sanctuary: who is so great a God, as our God!
77.14: Thou art the God that doest wonders; thou hast declared thy power among the people.
77.15: Thou hast redeemed thy people with thine arm, even the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
77.16: The waters saw thee, O God: the waters saw thee, and were afraid: yea, the depths trembled.
77.17: The clouds poured out water: the heavens gave a sound: yea, thine arrows went abroad.
77.18: The voice of thy thunder was round about; the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.
77.19: Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.
77.20: Thou didst lead thy people like sheep by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

78.1: Hear my doctrine, O my people: incline your ears unto the words of my mouth.
78.2: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will declare high sentences of old.
78.3: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
78.4: We will not hide them from their children, but to the generation to come we will show the praise of the Lord, his power also, and his wonderful works that he hath done:
78.5: How he established a testimony in Jacob, and ordained a Law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should teach their children:
78.6: That the posterity might know it, and the children, which should be born, should stand up, and declare it to their children.
78.7: That they might set their hope on God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
78.8: And not to be as their fathers, a disobedient and rebellious generation: a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not faithful unto God.
78.9: The children of Ephraim being armed and shooting with the bow, turned back in the day of battle.
78.10: They kept not the Covenant of God, but refused to walk in his Law,
78.11: And forgate his acts, and his wonderful works that he had showed them.
78.12: He did marvelous things in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt; even in the field of Zoan.
78.13: He divided the Sea, and led them through: he made also the waters to stand as an heap.
78.14: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
78.15: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as of the great depths.
78.16: He brought floods also out of the stony rock, so that he made the waters to descend like the rivers.
78.17: Yet they sinned still against him, and provoked the Highest in the wilderness,
78.18: And tempted God in their hearts in requiring meat for their lust.
78.19: They spake against God also, saying, Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
78.20: Behold, he smote the rock, that the water gushed out, and the streams overflowed: can he give bread also? or prepare flesh for his people?
78.21: Therefore the Lord heard, and was angry, and the fire was kindled in Jacob, and also wrath came upon Israel,
78.22: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his help.
78.23: Yet he had commanded the clouds above, and had opened the doors of heaven,
78.24: And had rained down Manna upon them for to eat, and had given them of the wheat of heaven.
78.25: Man did eat the bread of Angels: he sent them meat enough.
78.26: He caused the East wind to pass in the heaven: and through his power he brought in the South wind.
78.27: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowl as the sand of the sea.
78.28: And he made it fall in the midst of their camp, even round about their habitations.
78.29: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their desire.
78.30: They were not turned from their lusts, but the meat was yet in their mouths,
78.31: When the wrath of God came even upon them, and slew the strongest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
78.32: For all this they sinned still, and believed not his wondrous works.
78.33: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years hastily.
78.34: And when he slew them, they sought him, and they returned, and sought God early.
78.35: And they remembered that God was their strength, and the most high God their redeemer.
78.36: But they flattered him with their mouth, and dissembled with him with their tongue.
78.37: For their heart was not upright with him: neither were they faithful in his covenant.
78.38: Yet he being merciful, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not, but oft times called back his anger, and did not stir up all his wrath.
78.39: For he remembered that they were flesh: yea, a wind that passeth and cometh not again.
78.40: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness? and grieve him in the desert?
78.41: Yea, they returned and tempted God, and limited the Holy one of Israel.
78.42: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy,
78.43: Nor him that set his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan,
78.44: And turned their rivers into blood, and their floods, that they could not drink.
78.45: He sent a swarm of flies among them, which devoured them, and frogs, which destroyed them.
78.46: He gave also their fruits unto the caterpillar, and their labor unto the grasshopper.
78.47: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their wild fig trees with the hailstone.
78.48: He gave their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to the thunderbolts.
78.49: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, indignation and wrath, and vexation by the sending out of evil angels.
78.50: He made a way to his anger: he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life to the pestilence,
78.51: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt, even the beginning of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham.
78.52: But he made his people to go out like sheep, and led them in the wilderness like a flock.
78.53: Yea, he carried them out safely, and they feared not, and the Sea covered their enemies.
78.54: And he brought them unto the borders of his Sanctuary: even to this Mountain which his right hand purchased.
78.55: He cast out the heathen also before them, and caused them to fall to the lot of his inheritance, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.
78.56: Yet they tempted, and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies,
78.57: But turned back, and dealt falsely like their fathers: they turned like a deceitful bow.
78.58: And they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to wrath with their graven images.
78.59: God heard this and was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel,
78.60: So that he forsook the habitation of Shiloh, even the Tabernacle where he dwelt among men,
78.61: And delivered his power into captivity, and his beauty into the enemy’s hand.
78.62: And he gave up his people to the sword, and was angry with his inheritance.
78.63: The fire devoured their chosen men, and their maids were not praised.
78.64: Their Priests fell by the sword, and their widows lamented not.
78.65: But the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and as a strong man that after his wine crieth out,
78.66: And smote his enemies in the hinder parts, and put them to a perpetual shame.
78.67: Yet he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
78.68: But chose the tribe of Judah, and mount Zion which he loved.
78.69: And he built his Sanctuary as an high palace, like the earth, which he established forever.
78.70: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds.
78.71: Even from behind the ewes with young, brought he him to feed his people in Jacob, and his inheritance in Israel.
78.72: So he fed them according to the simplicity of his heart, and guided them by the discretion of his hands.

79.1: O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance: thine holy Temple have they defiled, and made Jerusalem heaps of stones.
79.2: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto fowls of the heaven, and the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.
79.3: Their blood have they shed like waters, round about Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.
79.4: We are a reproach to our neighbors, even a scorn and derision unto them that are round about us.
79.5: Lord, how long wilt thou be angry, forever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
79.6: Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy Name.
79.7: For they have devoured Jacob, and made his dwelling place desolate.
79.8: Remember not against us the former iniquities, but make haste, and let thy tender mercies prevent us: for we are in great misery.
79.9: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy Name, and deliver us, and be merciful unto our sins for thy Name’s sake.
79.10: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let them be known among the heathen in our sight by the vengeance of the blood of thy servants that is shed.
79.11: Let the sighing of the prisoners come before thee: according to thy mighty arm preserve the children of death,
79.12: And render to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.
79.13: So we thy people, and sheep of thy pasture shall praise thee forever: and from generation to generation we will set forth thy praise.

80.1: Hear, O thou shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like sheep: show thy brightness, thou that sittest between the Cherubims.
80.2: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come to help us.
80.3: Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine that we may be saved.
80.4: O Lord God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
80.5: Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink with great measure.
80.6: Thou hast made us a strife unto our neighbors, and our enemies laugh at us among themselves.
80.7: Turn us again, O God of hosts: cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
80.8: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
80.9: Thou madest room for it, and didst cause it to take root, and it filled the land.
80.10: The mountains were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.
80.11: She stretched out her branches unto the Sea, and her boughs unto the river.
80.12: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all they, which pass by the way, have plucked her?
80.13: The wild boar out of the wood hath destroyed it, and the wild beasts of the field have eaten it up.
80.14: Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven and behold, and visit this vine,
80.15: And the vineyard, that thy right hand hath planted, and the young vine, which thou madest strong for thyself.
80.16: It is burnt with fire, and cut down: and they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
80.17: Let thine hand be upon the man of thy right hand, and upon the son of man, whom thou madest strong for thine own self.
80.18: So will not we go back from thee, revive thou us, and we shall call upon thy Name.
80.19: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts: cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.

81.1: Sing joyfully unto God our strength: sing loud unto the God of Jacob.
81.2: Take the song and bring forth the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the viol.
81.3: Blow the trumpet in the new moon, even in the time appointed at our feast day.
81.4: For this is a statute for Israel, and a Law of the God of Jacob.
81.5: He set this in Joseph for a testimony, when he came out of the land of Egypt, where I heard a language, that I understood not.
81.6: I have withdrawn his shoulder from the burden, and his hands have left the pots.
81.7: Thou calledst in affliction, and I delivered thee, and answered thee in the secret of the thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
81.8: Hear, O my people, and I will protest unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me,
81.9: And wilt have no strange god in thee, neither worship any strange god,
81.10: (For I am the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt:) open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
81.11: But my people would not hear my voice, and Israel would none of me,
81.12: So I gave them up unto the hardness of their heart, and they have walked in their own counsels.
81.13: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
81.14: I would soon have humbled their enemies, and turned mine hand against their adversaries.
81.15: The haters of the Lord should have been subject unto him, and their time should have endured forever.
81.16: And God would have fed them with the fat of wheat, and with honey out of the rock would I have sufficed thee.

82.1: God standeth in the assembly of gods: he judgeth among gods.
82.2: How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.
82.3: Do right to the poor and fatherless: do justice to the poor and needy.
82.4: Deliver the poor and needy: save them from the hand of the wicked.
82.5: They know not and understand nothing: they walk in darkness, albeit all the foundations of the earth be moved.
82.6: I have said, Ye are gods, and ye all are children of the most High.
82.7: But ye shall die as a man, and ye princes shall fall like others.
82.8: O God, arise, therefore judge thou the earth: for thou shalt inherit all nations.

83.1: Keep not thou silence, O God: be not still, and cease not, O God.
83.2: For lo, thine enemies make a tumult, and they that hate thee, have lifted up the head.
83.3: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and have consulted against thy secret ones.
83.4: They have said, Come and let us cut them off from being a nation: and let the name of Israel be no more in remembrance.
83.5: For they have consulted together in heart, and have made a league against thee:
83.6: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagarites:
83.7: Gebal and Ammon, and Amalek, the Philistines, with the inhabitants of Tyre.
83.8: Assyria also is joined with them: they have been an arm to the children of Lot. Selah.
83.9: Do thou to them as unto the Midianites: as to Sisera and as to Jabin at the river of Kishon.
83.10: They perished at En Dor, and were dung for the earth.
83.11: Make them, even their princes, like Oreb and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes like Zebah and like Zalmunna,
83.12: Which have said, Let us take for our possession the habitations of God.
83.13: O my God, make them like unto a wheel, and as the stubble before the wind.
83.14: As the fire burneth the forest, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire:
83.15: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.
83.16: Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek thy Name, O Lord.
83.17: Let them be confounded and troubled forever: yea, let them be put to shame, and perish,
83.18: That they may know that thou, which art calleth Jehovah, art alone, even the most High over all the earth.

84.1: O Lord of hosts, how amiable are thy Tabernacles?
84.2: My soul longeth, yea, and fainted for the courts of the Lord: for my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.
84.3: Yea, the sparrow hath found her an house, and the swallow a nest for her, where she may lay her young: even by thine altars, O Lord of hosts, my king and my God.
84.4: Blessed are they that dwell in thine house, they will ever praise thee. Selah.
84.5: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee, and in whose heart are thy ways.
84.6: They going through the valley of Baca, make wells therein: the rain also covereth the pools.
84.7: They go from strength to strength, till every one appear before God in Zion.
84.8: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer, hearken, O God of Jacob. Selah.
84.9: Behold, O God, our shield, and look upon the face of thine Anointed.
84.10: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand other where: I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tabernacles of wickedness.
84.11: For the Lord God is the sun and shield unto us: the Lord will give grace and glory, and no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
84.12: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.

85.1: Lord, thou hast been favorable unto thy land: thou hast brought again the captivity of Jacob.
85.2: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, and covered all their sins. Selah.
85.3: Thou hast withdrawn all thine anger, and hast turned back from the fierceness of thy wrath.
85.4: Turn us, O God of our salvation, and release thine anger toward us.
85.5: Wilt thou be angry with us forever? and wilt thou prolong thy wrath from one generation to another?
85.6: Wilt thou not turn again and quicken us, that thy people may rejoice in thee?
85.7: Show us thy mercy, O Lord, and grant us thy salvation.
85.8: I will hearken what the Lord God will say: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his Saints, that they turn not again to folly.
85.9: Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.
85.10: Mercy and truth shall meet, righteousness and peace shall kiss one another.
85.11: Truth shall bud out of the earth, and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
85.12: Yea, the Lord shall give good things, and our land shall give her increase.
85.13: Righteousness shall go before him, and shall set her steps in the way.

86.1: Incline thine ear, O Lord, and hear me: for I am poor and needy.
86.2: Preserve thou my soul, for I am merciful: my God, save thou thy servant, that trusteth in thee.
86.3: Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry upon thee continually.
86.4: Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
86.5: For thou, Lord, art good and merciful, and of great kindness unto all them that call upon thee.
86.6: Give ear, Lord, unto my prayer, and hearken to the voice of my supplication.
86.7: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou hearest me.
86.8: Among the gods there is none like thee, O Lord, and there is none that can do like thy works.
86.9: All nations whom thou hast made, shall come and worship before thee, O Lord, and shall glorify thy Name.
86.10: For thou art great and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.
86.11: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and I will walk in thy truth: knit mine heart unto thee, that I may fear thy Name.
86.12: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all mine heart: yea, I will glorify thy Name forever.
86.13: For great is thy mercy toward me, and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest grave.
86.14: O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought my soul, and have not set thee before them.
86.15: But thou, O Lord, art a pitiful God and merciful, slow to anger, and great in kindness and truth.
86.16: Turn unto me, and have mercy upon me: give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.
86.17: Show a token of thy goodness toward me, that they which hate me, may see it, and be ashamed, because thou, O Lord, hast helped me and comforted me.

87.1: God laid his foundations among the holy mountains.
87.2: The Lord loveth the gates of Zion above all the habitations of Jacob.
87.3: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
87.4: I will make mention of Rahab and Babel among them that know me: behold Palestine and Tyre with Ethiopia, There is he born.
87.5: And of Zion it shall be said, Many are born in her: and he, even the most High shall stablish her.
87.6: The Lord shall count, when he writeth the people, He was born there. Selah.
87.7: As well the singers as the players on instruments shall praise thee: all my springs are in thee.

88.1: O Lord God of my salvation, I cry day and night before thee.
88.2: Let my prayer enter into thy presence: incline thine ear unto my cry.
88.3: For my soul is filled with evils, and my life draweth near to the grave.
88.4: I am counted among them that go down unto the pit, and am as a man without strength,
88.5: Free among the dead, like the slain laying in the grave, when thou rememberest no more, and they are cut off from thy hand.
88.6: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, and in the deep.
88.7: Thine indignation lieth upon me, and thou hast vexed me with all thy waves. Selah.
88.8: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me, and made me to be abhorred of them: I am shut up, and cannot get forth.
88.9: Mine eye is sorrowful through mine affliction: Lord, I call daily upon thee: I stretch out mine hands unto thee.
88.10: Wilt thou show a miracle to the dead? or shall the dead rise and praise thee? Selah.
88.11: Shall thy loving kindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?
88.12: Shall thy wondrous works be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of oblivion?
88.13: But unto thee, have I cried, O Lord, and early shall my prayer come before thee.
88.14: Lord, why dost thou reject my soul, and hidest thy face from me?
88.15: I am afflicted and at the point of death: from my youth I suffer thy terrors, doubting of my life.
88.16: Thine indignations go over me, and thy fear hath cut me off.
88.17: They came round about me daily like water, and compassed me together.
88.18: My lovers and friends hast thou put away from me, and mine acquaintance hid themselves.

89.1: I will sing the mercies of the Lord forever: with my mouth will I declare thy truth from generation to generation.
89.2: For I said, Mercy shall be set up forever: thy truth shalt thou stablish in the very heavens.
89.3: I have made a covenant with my chosen: I have sworn to David my servant,
89.4: Thy seed will I stablish forever, and set up thy throne from generation to generation. Selah.
89.5: O Lord, even the heavens shall praise thy wondrous work: yea, thy truth in the Congregation of the Saints.
89.6: For who is equal to the Lord in the heaven? and who is like the Lord among the sons of the gods?
89.7: God is very terrible in the assembly of the Saints, and to be reverenced above all that are about him.
89.8: O Lord God of hosts, who is like unto thee, which art a mighty Lord, and thy truth is about thee?
89.9: Thou rulest the raging of the Sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
89.10: Thou hast beaten down Rahab as a man slain: thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy mighty arm.
89.11: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: thou hast laid the foundation of the world, and all that therein is.
89.12: Thou hast created the North and the South: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy Name.
89.13: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
89.14: Righteousness and equity are the stablishment of thy throne: mercy and truth go before thy face.
89.15: Blessed is the people that can rejoice in thee: they shall walk in the light of thy countenance, O Lord.
89.16: They shall rejoice continually in thy Name, and in thy righteousness shall they exalt themselves.
89.17: For thou art the glory of their strength, and by thy favor our horns shall be exalted.
89.18: For our shield appertaineth to the Lord, and our King to the Holy one of Israel.
89.19: Thou spakest then in a vision unto thine Holy one, and saidest, I have laid help upon one that is mighty: I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
89.20: I have found David my servant: with mine holy oil have I anointed him.
89.21: Therefore mine hand shall be established with him, and mine arm shall strengthen him.
89.22: The enemy shall not oppress him, neither shall the wicked hurt him.
89.23: But I will destroy his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
89.24: My truth also and my mercy shall be with him, and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.
89.25: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the floods.
89.26: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
89.27: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
89.28: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my Covenant shall stand fast with him.
89.29: His seed also will I make to endure forever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
89.30: But if his children forsake my Law, and walk not in my judgments:
89.31: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments:
89.32: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with strokes.
89.33: Yet my loving kindness will I not take from him, neither will I falsify my truth.
89.34: My Covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
89.35: I have sworn once by mine holiness, that I will not fail David, saying,
89.36: His seed shall endure forever, and his throne shall be as the sun before me.
89.37: He shall be established for evermore as the moon, and as a faithful witness in the heaven. Selah.
89.38: But thou hast rejected and abhorred, thou hast been angry with thine anointed.
89.39: Thou hast broken the Covenant of thy servant, and profaned his crown, casting it on the ground.
89.40: Thou hast broken down all his walls: thou hast laid his fortresses in ruin.
89.41: All that go by the way, spoil him: he is a rebuke unto his neighbors.
89.42: Thou hast set up the right hand of his enemies, and made all his adversaries to rejoice.
89.43: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
89.44: Thou hast caused his dignity to decay, and cast his throne to the ground.
89.45: The days of his youth hast thou shortened, and covered him with shame. Selah.
89.46: Lord, how long wilt thou hide thyself, forever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
89.47: Remember of what time I am: wherefore shouldest thou create in vain all the children of men?
89.48: What man liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
89.49: Lord, where are thy former mercies, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
89.50: Remember, O Lord, the rebuke of thy servants, which I bear in my bosom of all the mighty people.
89.51: For thine enemies have reproached thee, O Lord, because they have reproached the footsteps of thine Anointed.
89.52: Praised be the Lord for evermore. So be it, even so be it.

90.1: Lord, thou hast been our habitation from generation to generation.
90.2: Before the mountains were made, and before thou hadst formed the earth, and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting thou art our God.
90.3: Thou turnest man to destruction: again thou sayest, Return ye sons of Adam.
90.4: For a thousand years in thy sight are as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
90.5: Thou hast overflowed them, they are as a sleep, in the morning he groweth like the grass:
90.6: In the morning it flourisheth and groweth, but in the evening it is cut down and withereth.
90.7: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.
90.8: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, and our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
90.9: For all our days are past in thine anger: we have spent our years as a thought.
90.10: The time of our life is threescore years and ten, and if they be of strength, fourscore years: yet their strength is but labor and sorrow: for it is cut off quickly, and we flee away.
90.11: Who knoweth the power of thy wrath? for according to thy fear is thine anger.
90.12: Teach us so to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
90.13: Return (O Lord, how long?) and be pacified toward thy servants.
90.14: Fill us with thy mercy in the morning: so shall we rejoice and be glad all our days?
90.15: Comfort us according to the days that thou hast afflicted us, and according to the years that we have seen evil.
90.16: Let thy work be seen toward thy servants, and thy glory upon their children.
90.17: And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us, and direct thou the work of our hands upon us, even direct the work of our hands.

91.1: Who so dwelleth in the secret of the most High, shall abide in the shadow of the Almighty.
91.2: I will say unto the Lord, O my hope, and my fortress: he is my God, in him will I trust.
91.3: Surely I will deliver thee from the snare of the hunter, and from the noisome pestilence.
91.4: He will cover thee under his wings, and thou shalt be sure under his feathers: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
91.5: Thou shalt not be afraid of the fear of the night: nor of the arrow that flieth by day:
91.6: Nor of the pestilence that walketh in the darkness: nor of the plague that destroyeth at noon day.
91.7: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand, but it shall not come near thee.
91.8: Doubtless with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.
91.9: For thou hast said, The Lord is mine hope: thou hast set the most High for thy refuge.
91.10: There shall none evil come unto thee, neither shall any plague come near thy tabernacle.
91.11: For he shall give his Angels charge over thee to keep thee in all thy ways.
91.12: They shall bear thee in their hands, that thou hurt not thy foot against a stone.
91.13: Thou shalt walk upon the lion and asp: the young lion, and the dragon shalt thou tread under feet.
91.14: Because he hath loved me, therefore will I deliver him: I will exalt him because he hath known my Name.
91.15: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him: I will be with him in trouble: I will deliver him, and glorify him.
91.16: With long life will I satisfy him, and show him my salvation.

92.1: It is a good thing to praise the Lord, and to sing unto thy Name, O most High,
92.2: To declare thy loving kindness in the morning, and thy truth in the night,
92.3: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the viol, with the song upon the harp.
92.4: For thou Lord, hast made me glad by thy works, and I will rejoice in the works of thine hands.
92.5: O Lord, how glorious are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
92.6: An unwise man knoweth it not, and a fool doth not understand this,
92.7: (When the wicked grow as the grass, and all the workers of wickedness do flourish) that they shall be destroyed forever.
92.8: But thou, O Lord, art most High forevermore.
92.9: For lo, thine enemies, O Lord: for lo, thine enemies shall perish: all the workers of iniquity shall be destroyed.
92.10: But thou shalt exalt mine horn, like the unicorns, and I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
92.11: Mine eye also shall see my desire against mine enemies: and mine ears shall hear my wish against the wicked, that rise up against me.
92.12: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree, and shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
92.13: Such as be planted in the house of the Lord, shall flourish in the courts of our God.
92.14: They shall still bring forth fruit in their age: they shall be fat and flourishing,
92.15: To declare that the Lord my rock is righteous, and that none iniquity is in him.

93.1: The Lord reigneth, and is clothed with majesty: the Lord is clothed, and girded with power, the world also shall be established, that it cannot be moved.
93.2: Thy throne is established of old: thou art from everlasting.
93.3: The floods have lifted up, O Lord: the floods have lifted up their voice: the floods lift up their waves.
93.4: The waves of the sea are marvelous through the noise of many waters, yet the Lord on high is more mighty.
93.5: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine House, O Lord, forever.

94.1: O Lord God the avenger, O God the avenger, show thyself clearly.
94.2: Exalt thyself, O Judge of the world, and render a reward to the proud.
94.3: Lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
94.4: They prate and speak fiercely: all the workers of iniquity vaunt themselves.
94.5: They smite down thy people, O Lord, and trouble thine heritage.
94.6: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.
94.7: Yet they say, The Lord shall not see: neither will the God of Jacob regard it.
94.8: Understand, ye unwise among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
94.9: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? or he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
94.10: Or he that chastiseth the nations, shall he not correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall he not know?
94.11: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
94.12: Blessed is the man whom thou chastisest, O Lord, and teachest him in thy Law,
94.13: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of evil, while the pit is dug for the wicked.
94.14: Surely the Lord will not fail his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
94.15: For judgment shall return to justice, and all the upright in heart shall follow after it.
94.16: Who will rise up with me against the wicked? or who will take my part against the workers of iniquity?
94.17: If the Lord had not helped me, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
94.18: When I said, My foot slideth, thy mercy, O Lord, stayed me.
94.19: In the multitude of my thoughts in mine heart, thy comforts have rejoiced my soul.
94.20: Hath the throne of iniquity fellowship with thee, which forgeth wrong for a Law?
94.21: They gather them together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
94.22: But the Lord is my refuge, and my God is the rock of mine hope.
94.23: And he will recompense them their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice, yea, the Lord our God shall destroy them.

95.1: Come, let us rejoice unto the Lord: let us sing aloud unto the rock of our salvation.
95.2: Let us come before his face with praise: let us sing loud unto him with Psalms.
95.3: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods,
95.4: In whose hand are the deep places of the earth, and the heights of the mountains are his,
95.5: To whom the Sea belongeth, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
95.6: Come, let us worship and fall down, and kneel before the Lord our maker.
95.7: For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand: today, if ye will hear his voice,
95.8: Harden not your heart, as in Meribah, and as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
95.9: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, though they had seen my work.
95.10: Forty years have I contended with this generation, and said, They are a people that err in heart, for they have not known my ways.
95.11: Wherefore I sware in my wrath, saying, Surely they shall not enter into my rest.

96.1: Sing unto the Lord a new song: sing unto the Lord all the earth.
96.2: Sing unto the Lord, and praise his Name: declare his salvation from day to day.
96.3: Declare his glory among all nations, and his wonders among all people.
96.4: For the Lord is great and much to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.
96.5: For all the gods of the people are idols: but the Lord made the heavens.
96.6: Strength and glory are before him: power and beauty are in his Sanctuary.
96.7: Give unto the Lord, ye families of the people: give unto the Lord glory and power.
96.8: Give unto the Lord the glory of his Name: bring an offering, and enter into his courts.
96.9: Worship the Lord in the glorious Sanctuary: tremble before him all the earth.
96.10: Say among the Nations, The Lord reigneth: Surely the world shall be stable, and not move, and he shall judge the people in righteousness.
96.11: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad: let the sea roar, and all that therein is.
96.12: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it: let all the trees of the wood then rejoice,
96.13: Before the Lord: for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he will judge the world with righteousness, and the people in his truth.

97.1: The Lord reigneth: let the earth rejoice: let the multitude of the Isles be glad.
97.2: Clouds and darkness are round about him: righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.
97.3: There shall go a fire before him, and burn up his enemies round about.
97.4: His lightnings gave light unto the world: the earth saw it and was afraid.
97.5: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
97.6: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.
97.7: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, and that glory in idols: worship him all ye gods.
97.8: Zion heard of it, and was glad: and the daughters of Judah rejoiced, because of thy judgments, O Lord.
97.9: For thou, Lord, art most High above all the earth: thou art much exalted above all gods.
97.10: Ye that love the Lord, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his Saints: he will deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
97.11: Light is sown for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.
97.12: Rejoice ye righteous in the Lord, and give thanks for his holy remembrance.

98.1: Sing unto the Lord a new song: for he hath done marvelous things: his right hand, and his holy arm have gotten him the victory.
98.2: The Lord declared his salvation: his righteousness hath he revealed in the sight of the nations.
98.3: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
98.4: All the earth, sing ye loud unto the Lord: cry out and rejoice, and sing praises.
98.5: Sing praise to the Lord upon the harp, even upon the harp with a singing voice.
98.6: With shalms and sound of trumpets sing loud before the Lord the king.
98.7: Let the sea roar, and all that therein is, the world, and they that dwell therein.
98.8: Let the floods clap their hands, and let the mountains rejoice together,
98.9: Before the Lord: for he is come to judge the earth: with righteousness shall he judge the world: and the people with equity.

99.1: The Lord reigneth, let the people tremble: he sitteth between the Cherubims, let the earth be moved.
99.2: The Lord is great in Zion, and he is high above all the people.
99.3: They shall praise thy great and fearful Name (for it is holy.)
99.4: And the King’s power, that loveth judgment: for thou hast prepared equity: thou hast executed judgment and justice in Jacob.
99.5: Exalt the Lord our God, and fall down before his footstool: for he is holy.
99.6: Moses and Aaron were among his Priests, and Samuel among such as call upon his Name: these called upon the Lord, and he heard them.
99.7: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the Law that he gave them.
99.8: Thou heardest them, O Lord our God: thou wast a favorable God unto them, though thou didst take vengeance for their inventions.
99.9: Exalt the Lord our God and fall down before his holy Mountain: for the Lord our God is holy.

100.1: Sing ye loud unto the Lord, all the earth.
100.2: Serve the Lord with gladness; come before him with joyfulness.
100.3: Know ye that even the Lord is God; he hath made us, and not we ourselves: we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
100.4: Enter into his gates with praise, and into his courts with rejoicing: praise him and bless his Name.
100.5: For the Lord is good: his mercy is everlasting, and his truth is from generation to generation.

101.1: I will sing mercy and judgment: unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.
101.2: I will do wisely in the perfect way, till thou comest to me, I will walk in the uprightness of mine heart in the midst of my house.
101.3: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that fall away: it shall not cleave unto me.
101.4: A froward heart shall depart from me; I will know none evil.
101.5: Him that privily slandereth his neighbor, will I destroy: him that hath a proud look and high heart, I cannot suffer.
101.6: Mine eyes shall be unto the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.
101.7: There shall no deceitful person dwell within my house: he that telleth lies, shall not remain in my sight.
101.8: Betimes will I destroy all the wicked of the land that I may cut off all the workers of iniquity from the City of the Lord.

102.1: O Lord hear my prayer, and let my cry come unto thee.
