102.2: Hide not thy face from me in the time of my trouble: incline thine ears unto me, when I call, make haste to hear me.
102.3: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burnt like an hearth.
102.4: Mine heart is smitten, and withered like grass, because I forgat to eat my bread.
102.5: For the voice of my groaning, my bones do cleave to my skin.
102.6: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the deserts.
102.7: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
102.8: Mine enemies revile me daily, and they that rage against me, have sworn against me.
102.9: Surely I have eaten ashes as bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,
102.10: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast heaved me up, and cast me down.
102.11: My days are like a shadow that fadeth, and I am withered like grass.
102.12: But thou, O Lord, dost remain forever, and thy remembrance from generation to generation.
102.13: Thou wilt arise and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to have mercy thereon, for the appointed time is come.
102.14: For thy servants delight in the stones thereof, and have pity on the dust thereof.
102.15: Then the heathen shall fear the Name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory,
102.16: When the Lord shall build up Zion, and shall appear in his glory,
102.17: And shall turn unto the prayer of the desolate, and not despise their prayer.
102.18: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created, shall praise the Lord.
102.19: For he hath looked down from the height of his Sanctuary: out of the heaven did the Lord behold the earth,
102.20: That he might hear the mourning of the prisoner, and deliver the children of death.
102.21: That they may declare the Name of the Lord in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem,
102.22: When the people shall be gathered together, and the kingdoms to serve the Lord.
102.23: He abated my strength in the way, and shortened my days.
102.24: And I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years endure from generation to generation.
102.25: Thou hast aforetime laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of thine hands.
102.26: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: even they all shall wax old as doth a garment: as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed.
102.27: But thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.
102.28: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall stand fast in thy sight.

103.1: My soul, praise thou the Lord, and all that is within me, praise his holy Name.
103.2: My soul, praise thou the Lord, and forget not all his benefits.
103.3: Which forgiveth all thine iniquity, and healeth all thine infirmities.
103.4: Which redeemeth thy life from the grave; and crowneth thee with mercy and compassions.
103.5: Which satisfieth thy mouth with good things: and thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
103.6: The Lord executeth righteousness and judgment to all that are oppressed.
103.7: He made his ways known unto Moses, and his works unto the children of Israel.
103.8: The Lord is full of compassion and mercy, slow to anger and of great kindness.
103.9: He will not always chide, neither keep his anger forever.
103.10: He hath not dealt with us after our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
103.11: For as high as the heaven is above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.
103.12: As far as the East is from the West: so far hath he removed our sins from us.
103.13: As a father hath compassion on his children, so hath the Lord compassion on them that fear him.
103.14: For he knoweth whereof we be made: he remembereth that we are but dust.
103.15: The days of man are as grass: as a flower of the field, so flourisheth he.
103.16: For the wind goeth over it, and it is gone, and the place thereof shall know it no more.
103.17: But the loving kindness of the Lord endureth forever and ever upon them that fear him, and his righteousness upon children’s children,
103.18: Unto them that keep his covenant, and think upon his commandments to do them.
103.19: The Lord hath prepared his throne in heaven, and his kingdom ruleth over all.
103.20: Praise the Lord, ye his Angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandment in obeying the voice of his word.
103.21: Praise the Lord all ye his hosts, ye his servants that do his pleasure.
103.22: Praise the Lord all ye his works, in all places of his dominion: my soul, praise thou the Lord.

104.1: My soul, praise thou the Lord: O Lord my God, thou art exceeding great, thou art clothed with glory and honor.
104.2: Which covereth himself with light, as with a garment, and spreadeth the heavens like a curtain.
104.3: Which layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters, and maketh the clouds his chariot, and walketh upon the wings of the wind.
104.4: Which maketh the spirits his messengers, and a flaming fire his ministers.
104.5: He set the earth upon her foundations, so that it shall never move.
104.6: Thou coverest it with the deep as with a garment: the waters would stand above the mountains.
104.7: But at thy rebuke they flee: at the voice of thy thunder they haste away.
104.8: And the mountains ascend, and the valleys descend to the place which thou hast established for them.
104.9: But thou hast set them a bound which they shall not pass: they shall not return to cover the earth.
104.10: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run between the mountains.
104.11: They shall give drink to all the beasts of the field, and the wild asses shall quench their thirst.
104.12: By these springs shall the fowls of the heaven dwell, and sing among the branches.
104.13: He watereth the mountains from his chambers, and the earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.
104.14: He causeth grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the use of man, that he may bring forth bread out of the earth,
104.15: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread that strengtheneth man’s heart.
104.16: The high trees are satisfied, even the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted,
104.17: That the birds may make their nests there: the stork dwelleth in the fir trees.
104.18: The high mountains are for the goats: the rocks are a refuge for the conies.
104.19: He appointed the moon for certain seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.
104.20: Thou makest darkness, and it is night, wherein all the beasts of the forest creep forth.
104.21: The lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat at God.
104.22: When the sun riseth, they retire, and couch in their dens.
104.23: Then goeth man forth to his work, and to his labor until the evening.
104.24: O Lord, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.
104.25: So is the sea great and wide: for therein are things creeping innumerable, both small beasts and great.
104.26: There go the ships, yea that Leviathan, whom thou hast made to play therein.
104.27: All these wait upon thee, that thou mayest give them food in due season.
104.28: Thou givest it to them, and they gather it, thou openest thy hand, and they are filled with good things.
104.29: But if thou hide thy face, they are troubled: if thou take away their breath, they die and return to their dust:
104.30: Again if thou send forth thy spirit, they are created, and thou renewest the face of the earth.
104.31: Glory be to the Lord forever: let the Lord rejoice in his works.
104.32: He looketh on the earth and it trembleth: he toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.
104.33: I will sing unto the Lord all my life: I will praise my God, while I live.
104.34: Let my words be acceptable unto him: I will rejoice in the Lord.
104.35: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and the wicked till there be no more: O my soul, praise thou the Lord. Praise ye the Lord.

105.1: Praise the Lord, and call upon his Name: declare his works among the people.
105.2: Sing unto him, sing praise unto him, and talk of all his wondrous works.
105.3: Rejoice in his holy Name, let the heart of them that seek the Lord, rejoice.
105.4: Seek the Lord and his strength: seek his face continually.
105.5: Remember his marvelous works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
105.6: Ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob, which are his elect.
105.7: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are through all the earth.
105.8: He hath always remembered his covenant, and promise, that he made to a thousand generations,
105.9: Even that which he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac:
105.10: And since hath confirmed it to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
105.11: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance.
105.12: Albeit they were few in number, yea very few, and strangers in the land,
105.13: And walked about from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people,
105.14: Yet suffered he no man to do them wrong, but reproved Kings for their sakes, saying,
105.15: Touch not mine anointed, and do my Prophets no harm.
105.16: Moreover, he called a famine upon the land, and utterly brake the staff of bread.
105.17: But he sent a man before them: Joseph was sold for a slave.
105.18: They held his feet in the stocks, and he was laid in irons,
105.19: Until his appointed time came, and the counsel of the Lord had tried him.
105.20: The King sent and loosed him: even the Ruler of the people delivered him.
105.21: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance,
105.22: That he should bind his princes unto his will, and teach his Ancients wisdom.
105.23: Then Israel came to Egypt, and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.
105.24: And he increased his people exceedingly, and made them stronger than their oppressors.
105.25: He turned their heart to hate his people, and to deal craftily with his servants.
105.26: Then sent he Moses his servant, and Aaron whom he had chosen.
105.27: They showed among them the message of his signs, and wonders in the land of Ham.
105.28: He sent darkness, and made it dark: and they were not disobedient unto his commission.
105.29: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.
105.30: Their land brought forth frogs, even in their King’s chambers.
105.31: He spake, and there came swarms of flies and lice in all their quarters.
105.32: He gave them hail for rain, and flames of fire in their land.
105.33: He smote their vines also and their fig trees, and brake down the trees in their coasts.
105.34: He spake and the grasshoppers came, and caterpillars innumerable,
105.35: And did eat up all the grass in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.
105.36: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, even the beginning of all their strength.
105.37: He brought them forth also with silver and gold, and there was none feeble among their tribes.
105.38: Egypt was glad at their departing: for the fear of them had fallen upon them.
105.39: He spread a cloud to be a covering, and fire to give light in the night.
105.40: They asked, and he brought quails, and he filled them with the bread of heaven.
105.41: He opened the rock, and the water flowed out, and ran in the dry places like a river.
105.42: For he remembered his holy promise to Abraham his servant,
105.43: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness,
105.44: And gave them the lands of the heathen, and they took the labors of the people in possession,
105.45: That they might keep his statutes, and observe his Laws. Praise ye the Lord.

106.1: Praise ye the Lord because he is good, for his mercy endureth forever.
106.2: Who can express the noble acts of the Lord, or show forth all his praise?
106.3: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and do righteousness at all times.
106.4: Remember me, O Lord, with the favor of thy people: visit me with thy salvation,
106.5: That I may see the felicity of thy chosen, and rejoice in the joy of thy people, and glory with thine inheritance.
106.6: We have sinned with our fathers: we have committed iniquity, and done wickedly.
106.7: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt, neither remembered they the multitude of thy mercies, but rebelled at the Sea, even at the red sea.
106.8: Nevertheless he saved them for his Name’s sake, that he might make his power to be known.
106.9: And he rebuked the red sea, and it was dried up, and he led them in the deep, as in the wilderness.
106.10: And he saved them from the adversary’s hand, and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.
106.11: And the waters covered their oppressors: not one of them was left.
106.12: Then believed they his words, and sang praise unto him.
106.13: But incontinently they forgat his works, they waited not for his counsel,
106.14: But lusted with concupiscence in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.
106.15: Then he gave them their desire: but he sent leanness into their soul.
106.16: They envied Moses also in the tents, and Aaron the holy one of the Lord.
106.17: Therefore the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
106.18: And the fire was kindled in their assembly: the flame burnt up the wicked.
106.19: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.
106.20: Thus they turned their glory into the similitude of a bullock, that eateth grass.
106.21: They forgat God their Savior, which had done great things in Egypt,
106.22: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and fearful things by the red sea.
106.23: Therefore he minded to destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood in the breach before him to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
106.24: Also they contemned that pleasant land, and believed not his word,
106.25: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord.
106.26: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to destroy them in the wilderness,
106.27: And to destroy their seed among the nations, and to scatter them throughout the countries.
106.28: They joined themselves also unto Baal of Peor, and did eat the offerings of the dead.
106.29: Thus they provoked him unto anger with their own inventions, and the plague brake in upon them.
106.30: But Phinehas stood up, and executed judgment, and the plague was stayed.
106.31: And it was imputed unto him for righteousness from generation to generation forever.
106.32: They angered him also at the waters of Meribah, so that Moses was punished for their sakes,
106.33: Because they vexed his Spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
106.34: Neither destroyed they the people, as the Lord had commanded them,
106.35: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works,
106.36: And served their idols, which were their ruin.
106.37: Yea, they offered their sons, and their daughters unto devils,
106.38: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons, and of their daughters whom they offered unto the idols of Canaan, and the land was defiled with blood.
106.39: Thus were they stained with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.
106.40: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people, and he abhorred his own inheritance.
106.41: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen: and they that hated them were lords over them.
106.42: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were humbled under their hand.
106.43: Many a time did he deliver them, but they provoked him by their counsels: therefore they were brought down by their iniquity.
106.44: Yet he saw when they were in affliction, and he heard their cry.
106.45: And he remembered his covenant toward them, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies,
106.46: And gave them favor in the sight of all them that led them captives.
106.47: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen, that we may praise thine holy Name, and glory in thy praise.
106.48: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel forever and ever, and let all the people say, So be it. Praise ye the Lord.

107.1: Praise the Lord, because he is good: for his mercy endureth forever.
107.2: Let them, which have been redeemed of the Lord, show how he hath delivered them from the hand of the oppressor,
107.3: And gathered them out of the lands, from the East and from the West, from the North and from the South.
107.4: When they wandered in the desert and wilderness out of the way, and found no city to dwell in,
107.5: Both hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
107.6: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress,
107.7: And led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
107.8: Let them therefore confess before the Lord his loving kindness, and his wonderful works before the sons of men.
107.9: For he satisfied the thirsty soul, and filled the hungry soul with goodness.
107.10: They that dwell in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in misery and iron,
107.11: Because they rebelled against the words of the Lord, and despised the counsel of the most High,
107.12: When he humbled their heart with heaviness, then they fell down, and there was no helper.
107.13: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.
107.14: He brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death, and brake their bands asunder.
107.15: Let them therefore confess before the Lord his loving-kindness, and his wonderful works before the sons of men.
107.16: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and burst the bars of iron asunder,
107.17: Fools by reason of their transgression, and because of their iniquities are afflicted.
107.18: Their soul abhorreth all meat, and they are brought to death’s door.
107.19: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he delivereth them from their distress.
107.20: He sendeth his word and healeth them, and delivereth them from their graves.
107.21: Let them therefore confess before the Lord his loving kindness, and his wonderful works before the sons of men,
107.22: And let them offer sacrifices of praise, and declare his works with rejoicing.
107.23: They that go down to the sea in ships, and occupy by the great waters,
107.24: They see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.
107.25: For he commandeth and raiseth the stormy wind, and it lifteth up the waves thereof.
107.26: They mount up to the heaven, and descend to the deep, so that their soul melteth for trouble.
107.27: They are tossed to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and all their cunning is gone.
107.28: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distress.
107.29: He turneth the storm to calm, so that the waves thereof are still.
107.30: When they are quieted, they are glad, and he bringeth them unto the haven, where they would be.
107.31: Let them therefore confess before the Lord his loving kindness, and his wonderful works before the sons of men.
107.32: And let them exalt him in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the Elders.
107.33: He turneth the floods to a wilderness, and the springs of waters into dryness,
107.34: And a fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
107.35: Again he turneth the wilderness into pools of water, and the dry land into water springs.
107.36: And there he placeth the hungry, and they build a city to dwell in,
107.37: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which bring forth fruitful increase.
107.38: For he blesseth them, and they multiply exceedingly, and he diminisheth not their cattle.
107.39: Again men are diminished, and brought low by oppression, evil and sorrow.
107.40: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to err in desert places out of the way.
107.41: Yet he raiseth up the poor out of misery, and maketh him families like a flock of sheep.
107.42: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
107.43: Who is wise that he may observe these things? for they shall understand the loving kindness of the Lord.

108.1: O God, mine heart is prepared, so is my tongue: I will sing and give praise.
108.2: Awake viol and harp, I will awake early.
108.3: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people, and I will sing unto thee among the nations.
108.4: For thy mercy is great above the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.
108.5: Exalt thyself, O God, above the heavens, and let thy glory be upon all the earth,
108.6: That thy beloved may be delivered: help with thy right hand and hear me.
108.7: God hath spoken in his holiness: therefore I will rejoice, I shall divide Shechem and measure the valley of Succoth.
108.8: Gilead shall be mine, and Manasseh shall be mine: Ephraim also shall be the strength of mine head: Judah is my lawgiver.
108.9: Moab shall be my washpot: over Edom will I cast out my shoe: upon Palestine will I triumph.
108.10: Who will lead me into the strong city? who will bring me unto Edom?
108.11: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst forsaken us, and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?
108.12: Give us help against trouble: for vain is the help of man.
108.13: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he shall tread down our enemies.

109.1: Hold not thy tongue, O God of my praise.
109.2: For the mouth of the wicked, and the mouth full of deceit are opened upon me: they have spoken to me with a lying tongue.
109.3: They compassed me about also with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.
109.4: For my friendship they were my adversaries, but I gave myself to prayer.
109.5: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my friendship.
109.6: Set thou the wicked over him, and let the adversary stand at his right hand.
109.7: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned, and let his prayer be turned into sin.
109.8: Let his days be few, and let another take his charge.
109.9: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.
109.10: Let his children be vagabonds, and beg and seek bread, coming out of their places destroyed.
109.11: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath, and let the strangers spoil his labor.
109.12: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to show mercy upon his fatherless children.
109.13: Let his posterity be destroyed, and in the generation following, let their name be put out.
109.14: Let the iniquity of his fathers be had in remembrance with the Lord: and let not the sin of his mother be done away.
109.15: But let them always be before the Lord, that he may cut off their memorial from the earth.
109.16: Because he remembered not to show mercy, but persecuted the afflicted and poor man, and the sorrowful hearted to slay him.
109.17: As he loved cursing, so shall it come unto him, and as he loved not blessing, so shall it be far from him.
109.18: As he clothed himself with cursing like a raiment, so shall it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.
109.19: Let it be unto him as a garment to cover him, and for a girdle, wherewith he shall be always girded.
109.20: Let this be the reward of mine adversary from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
109.21: But thou, O Lord my God, deal with me according unto thy Name: deliver me, (for thy mercy is good)
109.22: Because I am poor and needy, and mine heart is wounded within me.
109.23: I depart like the shadow that declineth, and am shaken off as the grasshopper.
109.24: My knees are weak through fasting, and my flesh hath lost all fatness.
109.25: I became also a rebuke unto them: they that looked upon me, shaked their heads.
109.26: Help me, O Lord my God: save me according to thy mercy.
109.27: And they shall know that this is thine hand, and that thou, Lord, hast done it.
109.28: Though they curse, yet thou wilt bless: they shall arise and be confounded, but thy servant shall rejoice.
109.29: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their confusion as with a cloak.
109.30: I will give thanks unto the Lord greatly with my mouth, and praise him among the multitude.
109.31: For he will stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from them that would condemn his soul.

110.1: The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
110.2: The Lord shall send the rod of thy power out of Zion: be thou ruler in the midst of thine enemies.
110.3: Thy people shall come willingly at the time of assembling thine army in holy beauty: the youth of thy womb shall be as the morning dew.
110.4: The Lord sware, and will not repent, Thou art a Priest forever, after the order of Melchizedek.
110.5: The Lord that is at thy right hand, shall wound kings in the day of his wrath.
110.6: He shall be judge among the heathen: he shall fill all with dead bodies, and smite the head over great countries.
110.7: He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up his head.

111.1: I will praise the Lord with my whole heart in the assembly and the congregation of the just.
111.2: The works of the Lord are great, and ought to be sought out of all them that love them.
111.3: His work is beautiful and glorious, and his righteousness endureth forever.
111.4: He hath made his wonderful works to be had in remembrance: the Lord is merciful and full of compassion.
111.5: He hath given a portion unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.
111.6: He hath showed to his people the power of his works, in giving unto them the heritage of the heathen.
111.7: The works of his hands are truth and judgment: all his statutes are true.
111.8: They are established forever and ever, and are done in truth and equity.
111.9: He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant forever: holy and fearful is his Name.
111.10: The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the Lord: all they that observe them, have good understanding: his praise endureth forever.

112.1: Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord, and delighteth greatly in his commandments.
112.2: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the righteous shall be blessed.
112.3: Riches and treasures shall be in his house, and his righteousness endureth forever.
112.4: Unto the righteous ariseth light in darkness: he is merciful and full of compassion and righteous.
112.5: A good man is merciful, and lendeth, and will measure his affairs by judgment.
112.6: Surely he shall never be moved: but the righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.
112.7: He will not be afraid of evil tidings: for his heart is fixed, and believeth in the Lord.
112.8: His heart is established: therefore he will not fear, until he see his desire upon his enemies.
112.9: He hath distributed and given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth forever: his horn shall be exalted with glory.
112.10: The wicked shall see it, and be angry: he shall gnash with his teeth, and consume away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

113.1: Praise, O ye servants of the Lord, praise the Name of the Lord.
113.2: Blessed be the Name of the Lord from henceforth and forever.
113.3: The Lord’s Name is praised from the rising of the sun, unto the going down of the same.
113.4: The Lord is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.
113.5: Who is like unto the Lord our God, that hath his dwelling on high.
113.6: Who abaseth himself to behold things in the heavens and in the earth!
113.7: He raiseth the needy out of the dust, and lifteth up the poor out of the dung,
113.8: That he may set him with the princes, even with the princes of his people.
113.9: He maketh the barren woman to dwell with a family, and a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the Lord.

114.1: When Israel went out of Egypt, and the house of Jacob from the barbarous people,
114.2: Judah was his sanctification, and Israel his dominion.
114.3: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was turned back.
114.4: The mountains leaped like rams, and the hills as lambs!
114.5: What ailed thee, O sea, that thou fleddest? O Jordan, why wast thou turned back?
114.6: Ye mountains why leaped ye like rams, and ye hills as lambs?
114.7: The earth trembled at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
114.8: Which turneth the rock into waterpools, and the flint into a fountain of water.

115.1: Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto thy Name give the glory for thy loving mercy, and for thy truth’s sake.
115.2: Wherefore shall the heathen say, Where is now their God?
115.3: But our God is in heaven: he doeth whatsoever he will.
115.4: Their idols are silver and gold, even the work of men’s hands.
115.5: They have a mouth, and speak not: they have eyes, and see not.
115.6: They have ears, and hear not: they have noses and smell not.
115.7: They have hands, and touch not: they have feet, and walk not: neither make they a sound with their throat.
115.8: They that make them are like unto them: so are all that trust in them.
115.9: O Israel, trust thou in the Lord: for he is their help, and their shield.
115.10: O house of Aaron trust ye in the Lord, for he is their help, and their shield.
115.11: Ye that fear the Lord, trust in the Lord: for he is their helper, and their shield.
115.12: The Lord hath been mindful of us, he will bless, he will bless the house of Israel, he will bless the house of Aaron.
115.13: He will bless them that fear the Lord, both small and great.
115.14: The Lord will increase his graces toward you, even toward you, and toward your children.
115.15: Ye are blessed of the Lord, which made the heaven and the earth.
115.16: The heavens, even the heavens are the Lord’s: but he hath given the earth to the sons of men.
115.17: The dead praise not the Lord, neither any that go down into the place of silence.
115.18: But we will praise the Lord from henceforth and forever. Praise ye the Lord.

116.1: I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my prayers.
116.2: For he hath inclined his ear unto me, when I did call upon him in my days.
116.3: When the snares of death compassed me, and the griefs of the grave caught me: When I found trouble and sorrow.
116.4: Then I called upon the Name of the Lord, saying, I beseech thee, O Lord, deliver my soul.
116.5: The Lord is merciful and righteous, and our God is full of compassion.
116.6: The Lord preserveth the simple: I was in misery, and he saved me.
116.7: Return unto thy rest, O my soul: for the Lord hath been beneficial unto thee,
116.8: Because thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
116.9: I shall walk before the Lord in the land of the living.
116.10: I believed, therefore did I speak: for I was sore troubled.
116.11: I said in my fear, All men are liars.
116.12: What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits toward me?
116.13: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the Name of the Lord.
116.14: I will pay my vows unto the Lord, even now in the presence of all his people.
116.15: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his Saints.
116.16: Behold, Lord: for I am thy servant, I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast broken my bonds.
116.17: I will offer to thee a sacrifice of praise, and will call upon the Name of the Lord.
116.18: I will pay my vows unto the Lord, even now in the presence of all his people,
116.19: In the courts of the Lord’s house, even in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.

117.1: All nations, praise ye the Lord: all ye people, praise him.
117.2: For his loving kindness is great toward us, and the truth of the Lord endureth forever. Praise ye the Lord.

118.1: Praise ye the Lord, because he is good: for his mercy endureth forever.
118.2: Let Israel now say, That his mercy endureth forever.
118.3: Let the house of Aaron now say, That his mercy endureth forever.
118.4: Let them that fear the Lord, now say, That his mercy endureth forever.
118.5: I called upon the Lord in trouble, and the Lord heard me, and set me at large.
118.6: The Lord is with me: therefore I will not fear what man can do unto me.
118.7: The Lord is with me among them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon mine enemies.
118.8: It is better to trust in the Lord, than to have confidence in man.
118.9: It is better to trust in the Lord, than to have confidence in princes.
118.10: All nations have compassed me: but in the Name of the Lord shall I destroy them.
118.11: They have compassed me, yea, they have compassed me: but in the Name of the Lord I shall destroy them.
118.12: They came about me like bees, but they were quenched as a fire of thorns: for in the Name of the Lord I shall destroy them.
118.13: Thou hast thrust sore at me, that I might fall: but the Lord hath helped me.
118.14: The Lord is my strength and song: for he hath been my deliverance.
118.15: The voice of joy and deliverance shall be in the tabernacles of the righteous, saying, The right hand of the Lord hath done valiantly.
118.16: The right hand of the Lord is exalted: the right hand of the Lord hath done valiantly.
118.17: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the Lord.
118.18: The Lord had chastened me sore, but he hath not delivered me to death.
118.19: Open ye unto me the gates of righteousness, that I may go into them, and praise the Lord.
118.20: This is the gate of the Lord: the righteous shall enter into it.
118.21: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and hast been my deliverance.
118.22: The stone, which the builders refused, is the head of the corner.
118.23: This was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes,
118.24: This is the day, which the Lord hath made: let us rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25: O Lord, I pray thee, save now: O Lord, I pray thee now give prosperity.
118.26: Blessed be he, that cometh in the Name of the Lord: we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.
118.27: The Lord is mighty, and hath given us light: bind the sacrifice with cords unto the horns of the altar.
118.28: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee, even my God: therefore I will exalt thee.
118.29: Praise ye the Lord, because he is good: for his mercy endureth forever.

119.1: Blessed are those that are upright in their way, and walk in the Law of the Lord.
119.2: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and seek him with their whole heart.
119.3: Surely they work none iniquity, but walk in his ways.
119.4: Thou hast commanded to keep thy precepts diligently.
119.5: Oh that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!
119.6: Then should I not be confounded, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.
119.7: I will praise thee with an upright heart, when I shall learn the judgments of thy righteousness.
119.8: I will keep thy statutes: forsake me not overlong.
119.9: Wherewith shall a young man redress his way? in taking heed thereto according to thy word.
119.10: With my whole heart have I sought thee: let me not wander from thy commandments.
119.11: I have hid thy promise in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.
119.12: Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy statutes.
119.13: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
119.14: I have had as great delight in the way of thy testimonies, as in all riches.
119.15: I will meditate in thy precepts, and consider thy ways.
119.16: I will delight in thy statutes, and I will not forget thy word.
119.17: Be beneficial unto thy servant, that I may live and keep thy word.
119.18: Open mine eyes, that I may see the wonders of thy Law.
119.19: I am a stranger upon earth: hide not thy commandments from me.
119.20: Mine heart breaketh for the desire to thy judgments always.
119.21: Thou hast destroyed the proud: cursed are they that do err from thy commandments.
119.22: Remove from me shame and contempt: for I have kept thy testimonies.
119.23: Princes also did sit, and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.
119.24: Also thy testimonies are my delight, and my counselors.
119.25: My soul cleaveth to the dust: quicken me according to thy word.
119.26: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
119.27: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts, and I will meditate in thy wondrous works.
119.28: My soul melteth for heaviness: raise me up according to thy word.
119.29: Take from me the way of lying, and grant me graciously thy Law.
119.30: I have chosen the way of truth, and thy judgments have I laid before me.
119.31: I have cleaved to thy testimonies, O Lord: confound me not.
119.32: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge mine heart.
119.33: Teach me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes, and I will keep it unto the end.
119.34: Give me understanding and I will keep thy Law, yea, I will keep it with my whole heart.
119.35: Direct me in the path of thy commandments: for therein is my delight.
119.36: Incline mine heart unto thy testimonies: and not to covetousness.
119.37: Turn away mine eyes from regarding vanity, and quicken me in thy way.
119.38: Stablish thy promise to thy servant, because he feareth thee.
119.39: Take away my rebuke that I fear: for thy judgments are good.
119.40: Behold, I desire thy commandments: quicken me in thy righteousness.
119.41: And let thy loving kindness come unto me, O Lord, and thy salvation according to thy promise.
119.42: So shall I make answer unto my blasphemers: for I trust in thy word.
119.43: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth: for I wait for thy judgments.
119.44: So shall I always keep thy Law forever and ever.
119.45: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.
119.46: I will speak also of thy testimonies before Kings, and will not be ashamed.
119.47: And my delight shall be in thy Commandments, which I have loved.
119.48: Mine hands also will I lift up unto thy Commandments, which I have loved, and I will meditate in thy statutes.
119.49: Remember the promise made to thy servant, wherein thou hast caused me to trust.
119.50: It is my comfort in my trouble; for thy promise hath quickened me.
119.51: The proud have had me exceedingly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy Law.
119.52: I remembered thy judgments of old, O Lord, and have been comforted.
119.53: Fear is come upon me for the wicked, that forsake thy Law.
119.54: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
119.55: I have remembered thy Name, O Lord, in the night, and have kept thy Law.
119.56: This I had because I kept thy precepts.
119.57: O Lord, that art my portion, I have determined to keep thy words.
119.58: I made my supplication in thy presence with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy promise.
119.59: I have considered my ways, and turned my feet into thy testimonies.
119.60: I made haste and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
119.61: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy Law.
119.62: At midnight will I rise to give thanks unto thee, because of thy righteous judgments.
119.63: I am companion of all them that fear thee, and keep thy precepts.
119.64: The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.
119.65: O Lord, thou hast dealt graciously with thy servant, according unto thy word.
119.66: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.
119.67: Before I was afflicted, I went astray: but now I keep thy word.
119.68: Thou art good and gracious: teach me thy statutes.
119.69: The proud have imagined a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.
119.70: Their heart is fat as grease, but my delight is in thy Law.
119.71: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I may learn thy statutes.
119.72: The Law of thy mouth is better unto me, than thousands of gold and silver.
119.73: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding therefore, that I may learn thy commandments.
119.74: So they that fear thee, seeing me, shall rejoice, because I have trusted in thy word.
119.75: I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are right, and that thou hast afflicted me justly.
119.76: I pray thee that thy mercy may comfort me, according to thy promise unto thy servant.
119.77: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy Law is my delight.
119.78: Let the proud be ashamed: for they have dealt wickedly and falsely with me: but I meditate in thy precepts.
119.79: Let such as fear thee turn unto me, and they that know thy testimonies.
119.80: Let mine heart be upright in thy statutes, that I be not ashamed.
119.81: My soul fainted for thy salvation: yet I wait for thy word.
119.82: Mine eyes fail for thy promise, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
119.83: For I am like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.
119.84: How many are the days of thy servant? When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
119.85: The proud have dug pits for me, which is not after thy Law.
119.86: All thy commandments are true: they persecute me falsely: help me.
119.87: They had almost consumed me upon the earth: but I forsook not thy precepts.
119.88: Quicken me according to thy loving kindness: so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.
119.89: O Lord, thy word endureth forever in heaven.
119.90: Thy truth is from generation to generation: thou hast laid the foundation of the earth, and it abideth.
119.91: They continue even to this day by thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.
119.92: Except thy law had been my delight, I should now have perished in mine affliction.
119.93: I will never forget thy precepts: for by them thou hast quickened me.
119.94: I am thine, save me: for I have sought thy precepts.
119.95: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.
119.96: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding large.
119.97: Oh how love I thy law! it is my meditation continually.
119.98: By thy commandments thou hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.
119.99: I have had more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.
119.100: I understood more than the ancient, because I kept thy precepts.
119.101: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.
119.102: I have not declined from thy judgments: for thou didst teach me.
119.103: How sweet are thy promises unto my mouth! yea, more than honey unto my mouth.
119.104: By thy precepts I have gotten understanding: therefore I hate all the ways of falsehood.
119.105: Thy word is a lantern unto my feet, and a light unto my paths.
119.106: I have sworn and will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
119.107: I am very sore afflicted: O Lord, quicken me according to thy word.
119.108: O Lord, I beseech thee, accept the free offering of my mouth, and teach me thy judgments.
119.109: My soul is continually in mine hand: yet do I not forget thy law.
119.110: The wicked have laid a snare for me: but I swerved not from thy precepts.
119.111: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage forever: for they are the joy of mine heart.
119.112: I have applied mine heart to fulfill thy statutes always, even unto the end.
119.113: I hate vain inventions: but thy Law do I love.
119.114: Thou art my refuge and shield, and I trust in thy word.
119.115: Away from me, ye wicked: for I will keep the commandments of my God.
119.116: Stablish me according to thy promise, that I may live, and disappoint me not of mine hope.
119.117: Stay thou me, and I shall be safe, and I will delight continually in thy statutes.
119.118: Thou hast trodden down all them that depart from thy statutes: for their deceit is vain.
119.119: Thou hast taken away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.
119.120: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee, and I am afraid of thy judgments.
119.121: I have executed judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressor.
119.122: Answer for thy servant in that which is good, and let not the proud oppress me.
119.123: Mine eyes have failed in waiting for thy salvation, and for thy just promise.
119.124: Deal with thy servant according to thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
119.125: I am thy servant: grant me therefore understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
119.126: It is time for thee, Lord, to work: for they have destroyed thy Law.
119.127: Therefore love I thy commandments above gold, yea, above most fine gold.
119.128: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts most just, and hate all false ways.
119.129: Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.
119.130: The entrance into thy words showeth light, and giveth understanding to the simple.
119.131: I opened my mouth, and panted, because I loved thy commandments.
119.132: Look upon me and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy Name.
119.133: Direct my steps in thy word, and let none iniquity have dominion over me.
119.134: Deliver me from the oppression of men, and I will keep thy precepts.
119.135: Show the light of thy countenance upon thy servant, and teach me thy statute.
119.136: Mine eyes gush out with rivers of water, because they keep not thy Law.
119.137: Righteous art thou, O Lord, and just are thy judgments.
119.138: Thou hast commanded justice by thy testimonies and truth especially.
119.139: My zeal hath even consumed me: because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.
119.140: Thy word is proved most pure, and thy servant loveth it.
119.141: I am small and despised: yet do I not forget thy precepts.
119.142: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy Law is truth.
119.143: Trouble and anguish are come upon me: yet are the commandments my delight.
119.144: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: grant me understanding, and I shall live.
119.145: I have cried with my whole heart: hear me, O Lord, and I will keep thy statutes.
119.146: I called upon thee: save me, and I will keep thy testimonies.
119.147: I prevented the morning light, and cried: for I waited on thy word.
119.148: Mine eyes prevent the night watches, to meditate in thy word.
119.149: Hear my voice according to thy loving kindness: O Lord, quicken me according to thy judgment.
119.150: They draw near that follow after malice, and are far from thy Law.
119.151: Thou art near, O Lord: for all thy commandments are true.
119.152: I have known long since by thy testimonies, that thou hast established them forever.
119.153: Behold mine affliction, and deliver me: for I have not forgotten thy law.
119.154: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according unto thy word.
119.155: Salvation is far from the wicked, because they seek not thy statutes.
119.156: Great art thy tender mercies, O Lord: quicken me according to thy judgments.
119.157: My persecutors and mine oppressors are many: yet do I not swerve from thy testimonies.
119.158: I saw the transgressors and was grieved, because they kept not thy word.
119.159: Consider, O Lord, how I love thy precepts: quicken me according to thy loving kindness.
119.160: The beginning of thy word is truth, and all the judgments of thy righteousness endure forever.
119.161: Princes have persecuted me without cause: but mine heart stood in awe of thy words.
119.162: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth a great spoil.
119.163: I hate falsehood and abhor it, but thy Law do I love.
119.164: Seven times a day do I praise thee, because of thy righteous judgments.
119.165: They that love thy law, shall have great prosperity, and they shall have none hurt.
119.166: Lord, I have trusted in thy salvation, and have done thy commandments.
119.167: My soul hath kept thy testimonies: for I love them exceedingly.
119.168: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.
119.169: Let my complaint come before thee, O Lord, and give me understanding according unto thy word.
119.170: Let my supplication come before thee, and deliver me according to thy promise.
119.171: My lips shall speak praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
119.172: My tongue shall entreat of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteous.
119.173: Let thine hand help me: for I have chosen thy precepts.
119.174: I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord, and thy Law is my delight.
119.175: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee, and thy judgments shall help me.
119.176: I have gone astray like a lost sheep: seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.

120.1: I called unto the Lord in my trouble, and he heard me.
120.2: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
120.3: What doth thy deceitful tongue bring unto thee? or what doth it avail thee?
120.4: It is as the sharp arrows of a mighty man, and as the coals of Juniper.
120.5: Woe is to me that I remain in Meshech, and dwell in the tents of Kedar.
120.6: My soul hath too long dwelt with him that hateth peace.
120.7: I seek peace, and when I speak thereof, they are bent to war.

121.1: I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains, from whence my help shall come.
121.2: Mine help cometh from the Lord, which hath made the heaven and the earth.
121.3: He will not suffer thy foot to slip: for he that keepeth thee, will not slumber.
121.4: Behold, he that keepeth Israel, will neither slumber nor sleep.
121.5: The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy shadow at thy right hand.
121.6: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
121.7: The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall keep thy soul.
121.8: The Lord shall preserve thy going out, and thy coming in from henceforth and forever.

122.1: I rejoiced when they said to me, We will go into the house of the Lord.
122.2: Our feet shall stand in thy gates, O Jerusalem.
122.3: Jerusalem is built as a city, that is compact together in itself:
122.4: Whereunto the Tribes, even the Tribes of the Lord go up according to the testimony to Israel, to praise the Name of the Lord.
122.5: For there are thrones set for judgment, even the thrones of the house of David.
122.6: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: let them prosper that love thee.
122.7: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.
122.8: For my brethren and neighbors’ sakes, I will wish thee now prosperity.
122.9: Because of the House of the Lord our God, I will procure thy wealth.

123.1: I lift up mine eyes to thee, that dwellest in the heavens.
123.2: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress: so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until he have mercy upon us.
123.3: Have mercy unto us, O Lord, have mercy upon us: for we have suffered too much contempt.
123.4: Our soul is filled too full of the mocking of the wealthy, and of the despitefulness of the proud.

124.1: If the Lord had not been on our side, (may Israel now say)
124.2: If the Lord had [not] been on our side, when men rose up against us,
124.3: They had then swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us.
124.4: Then the waters had drowned us, and the stream had gone over our soul:
124.5: Then had the swelling waters gone over our soul.
124.6: Praised be the Lord, which hath not given us as a prey unto their teeth.
124.7: Our soul is escaped, even as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are delivered.
124.8: Our help is in the Name of the Lord, which hath made heaven and earth.

125.1: They that trust in the Lord, shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but remaineth forever.
125.2: As the mountains are about Jerusalem: so is the Lord about his people from henceforth and forever.
125.3: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest on the lot of the righteous, lest the righteous put forth their hand unto wickedness.
125.4: Do well, O Lord, unto those that be good and true in their hearts.
125.5: But these that turn aside by their crooked ways, them shall the Lord lead with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.

126.1: When the Lord brought again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.
126.2: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with joy: then said they among the heathen, The Lord hath done great things for them.
126.3: The Lord hath done great things for us, whereof we rejoice.
126.4: O Lord, bring again our captivity, as the rivers in the South.
126.5: They that sow in tears, shall reap in joy.
126.6: They went weeping, and carried precious seed: but they shall return with joy, and bring their sheaves.

127.1: Except the Lord build the house, they labor in vain that build it: except the Lord keep the city, the keeper watcheth in vain.
127.2: It is in vain for you to rise early, and to lie down late, and eat the bread of sorrow: but he will surely give rest to his beloved.
127.3: Behold, children are the inheritance of the Lord, and the fruit of the womb his reward.
127.4: As are the arrows in the hand of the strong man; so are the children of youth.
127.5: Blessed is the man that hath his quiver full of them: for they shall not be ashamed, when they speak with their enemies in the gate.

128.1: Blessed is everyone that feareth the Lord, and walketh in his ways.
128.2: When thou eatest the labors of thine hands, thou shalt be blessed, and it shall be well with thee.
128.3: Thy wife shall be as the fruitful vine on the sides of thine house, and thy children like the olive plants round about thy table.
128.4: Lo, surely thus shall the man be blessed, that feareth the Lord.
128.5: The Lord out of Zion shall bless thee, and thou shalt see the wealth of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
128.6: Yea, thou shalt see thy children’s children, and peace upon Israel.

129.1: They have oftentimes afflicted me from my youth (may Israel now say)
129.2: They have oftentimes afflicted me from my youth: but they could not prevail against me.
129.3: The plowers plowed upon my back, and made long furrows.
129.4: But the righteous Lord hath cut the cords of the wicked.
129.5: They that hate Zion, shall be all ashamed and turned backward.
129.6: They shall be as the grass on the house tops, which withereth afore it cometh forth.
129.7: Whereof the mower filleth not his hand, neither the gleaner his lap:
129.8: Neither they which go by, say, The blessing of the Lord be upon you, or, We bless you in the Name of the Lord.

130.1: Out of the deep places have I called unto thee, O Lord.
130.2: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears attend to the voice of my prayers.
130.3: If thou, O Lord, straightly markest iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
130.4: But mercy is with thee, that thou mayest be feared.
130.5: I have waited on the Lord: my soul hath waited, and I have trusted in his word.
130.6: My soul waiteth on the Lord more than the morning watch watcheth for the morning.
130.7: Let Israel wait on the Lord: for with the Lord is mercy, and with him is great redemption.
130.8: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

131.1: Lord, mine heart is not haughty, neither are mine eyes lofty, neither have I walked in great matters and hid from me.
131.2: Surely I have behaved myself, like one weaned from his mother, and kept silence: I am in myself as one that is weaned.
131.3: Let Israel wait on the Lord from henceforth and forever.

132.1: Lord, remember David with all his affliction,
132.2: Who sware unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God, of Jacob, saying,
132.3: I will not enter into the Tabernacle of mine house, nor come upon my pallet or bed,
132.4: Nor suffer mine eyes to sleep, nor mine eyelids to slumber,
132.5: Until I find out a place for the Lord, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
132.6: Lo, we heard of it in Ephrathah, and found it in the fields of the forest.
132.7: We will enter into his Tabernacles, and worship before his footstool.
132.8: Arise, O Lord, to come into thy rest, thou, and the Ark of thy strength.
132.9: Let thy Priests be clothed with righteousness, and let thy Saints rejoice.
132.10: For thy servant David’s sake refuse not the face of thine Anointed.
132.11: The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David, and he will not shrink from it, saying, Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.
132.12: If thy sons keep my Covenant, and my testimonies, that I shall teach them, their sons also shall sit upon thy throne forever.
132.13: For the Lord hath chosen Zion, and loved to dwell in it, saying,
132.14: This is my rest forever: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.
132.15: I will surely bless her vittles, and will satisfy her poor with bread,
132.16: And will clothe her Priests with salvation, and her Saints shall shout for joy.
132.17: There will I make the horn of David to bud: for I have ordained a light for mine Anointed.
132.18: His enemies will I clothe with shame, but on him his crown shall flourish.

133.1: Behold, how good and how comely a thing it is, brethren to dwell even together.
133.2: It is like to the precious ointment upon the head, that runneth down upon the beard, even unto Aaron’s beard, which went down on the border of his garments,
133.3: And as the dew of Hermon which falleth upon the mountains of Zion: for there the Lord appointed the blessing and life forever.

134.1: Behold, praise ye the Lord, all ye servants of the Lord, ye that by night stand in the house of the Lord.
134.2: Lift up your hands to the Sanctuary, and praise the Lord.
134.3: The Lord that hath made heaven and earth, bless thee out of Zion.

135.1: Praise, the Name of the Lord; ye servants of the Lord, praise him.
135.2: Ye that stand in the House of the Lord, and in the courts of the House of our God,
135.3: Praise ye the Lord: for the Lord is good: sing praises unto his Name: for it is a comely thing.
135.4: For the Lord hath chosen Jacob to himself, and Israel for his chief treasure.
135.5: For I know that the Lord is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.
135.6: Whatsoever pleased the Lord, that did he in heaven and in earth, in the sea, and in all the depths.
135.7: He bringeth up the clouds from the ends of the earth, and maketh the lightnings with the rain: he draweth forth the wind out of his treasures.
135.8: He smote the firstborn of Egypt both of man and beast.
135.9: He hath sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.
135.10: He smote many nations, and slew mighty Kings:
135.11: As Sihon King of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:
135.12: And gave their land for an inheritance, even an inheritance unto Israel his people.
135.13: Thy Name, O Lord, endureth forever: O Lord, thy remembrance is from generation to generation.
135.14: For the Lord will judge his people, and be pacified toward his servants.
135.15: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, even the work of men’s hands.
135.16: They have a mouth, and speak not: they have eyes and see not.
135.17: They have ears and hear not, neither is there any breath in their mouth.
135.18: They that make them, are like unto them: so are all that trust in them.
135.19: Praise the Lord, ye house of Israel: praise the Lord, ye house of Aaron.
135.20: Praise the Lord, ye house of Levi; ye that fear the Lord, praise the Lord.
135.21: Praised be the Lord out of Zion, which dwelleth in Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.

136.1: Praise ye the Lord, because he is good: for his mercy endureth forever.
136.2: Praise ye the God of gods: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.3: Praise ye the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.4: Which only doeth great wonders; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.5: Which by his wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.6: Which hath stretched out the earth upon the waters: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.7: Which made great lights: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.8: As the Sun to rule the day; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.9: The Moon and the stars to govern the night: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.10: Which smote Egypt with their firstborn, (for his mercy endureth forever)
136.11: And brought out Israel from among them; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.12: With a mighty hand and stretched out arm; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.13: Which divideth the Sea into two parts; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.14: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.15: And overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the red Sea; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.16: Which led his people through the wilderness; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.17: Which smote great Kings: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.18: And slew mighty Kings: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.19: As Sihon King of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.20: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth forever:
136.21: And gave their land for an heritage; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.22: Even an heritage unto Israel his servant; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.23: Which remembered us in our base estate; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.24: And hath rescued us from our oppressors; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.25: Which giveth food to all flesh; for his mercy endureth forever:
136.26: Praise ye the God of heaven; for his mercy endureth forever.

137.1: By the rivers of Babel we sat, and there we wept, when we remembered Zion.
137.2: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
137.3: Then they that led us captive, required of us songs and mirth, when we had hanged up our harps, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
137.4: How shall we sing, said we, a song of the Lord in a strange land?
137.5: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget to play.
137.6: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth: yea, if I prefer not Jerusalem to my chief joy.
137.7: Remember the children of Edom, O Lord, in the day of Jerusalem, which said, Raze it, raze it to the foundation thereof.
137.8: O daughter of Babel, worthy to be destroyed, blessed shall he be that rewardeth thee, as thou hast served us.
137.9: Blessed shall he be that taketh and dasheth thy children against the stones.

138.1: I will praise thee with my whole heart: even before the gods will I praise thee.
138.2: I will worship toward thine holy Temple and praise thy Name, because of thy loving-kindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy Name above all things by thy word.
138.3: When I called, then thou heardest me, and hast increased strength in my soul.
138.4: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord: for they have heard the words of thy mouth.
138.5: And they shall sing of the ways of the Lord, because the glory of the Lord is great.
138.6: For the Lord is high, yet he beholdeth the lowly, but the proud he knoweth afar off.
138.7: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet wilt thou revive me: thou wilt stretch forth thine hand upon the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
138.8: The Lord will perform his work toward me: O Lord, thy mercy endureth forever: forsake not the works of thine hands.

139.1: O Lord, thou hast tried me, and known me.
139.2: Thou knowest my sitting and my rising: thou understandest my thought afar off.
139.3: Thou compassest my paths, and my lying down, and art accustomed to all my ways.
139.4: For there is not a word in my tongue, but lo, thou knowest it wholly, O Lord.
139.5: Thou holdest me strait behind and before, and layest thine hand upon me.
139.6: Thy knowledge is too wonderful for me: it is so high that I cannot attain unto it.
139.7: Whither shall I go from thy Spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
139.8: If I ascend into heaven, thou art there: if I lie down in hell, thou art there.
139.9: Let me take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea:
139.10: Yet thither shall thine hand lead me, and thy right hand hold me.
139.11: If I say, Yet the darkness shall hide me, even the night shall be light about me.
139.12: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee: but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and light are both alike.
139.13: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
139.14: I will praise thee, for I am fearfully and wondrously made: marvelous are thy works, and my soul knoweth it well.
139.15: My bones are not hid from thee, though I was made in a secret place, and fashioned beneath in the earth.
139.16: Thine eyes did see me, when I was without form: for in thy book were all things written, which in continuance were fashioned, when there was none of them before.
139.17: How dear therefore are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
139.18: If I should count them, they are more than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
139.19: Oh that thou wouldest [slay], O God, the wicked and bloody men, to whom I say, Depart ye from me:
139.20: Which speak wickedly of thee, and being thine enemies are lifted up in vain.
139.21: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee? and do not I earnestly contend with those that rise up against thee?
139.22: I hate them with an unfeigned hatred, as they were mine utter enemies.
139.23: Try me, O God, and know mine heart: prove me and know my thoughts,
139.24: And consider if there be any way of wickedness in me, and lead me in the way forever.

140.1: Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: preserve me from the cruel man:
140.2: Which imagine evil things in their heart, and make war continually.
140.3: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent: adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah.
140.4: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the cruel man, which purposeth to cause my steps to slide.
140.5: The proud have laid a snare for me, and spread a net with cords in my pathway, and set gins for me. Selah.
140.6: Therefore I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear, O Lord, the voice of my prayers.
140.7: O Lord God the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
140.8: Let not the wicked have his desire, O Lord; perform not his wicked thought, lest they be proud. Selah.
140.9: As for the chief of them that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips come upon them.
140.10: Let coals fall upon them: let him cast them into the fire, and into the deep pits that they rise not.
140.11: For the backbiter shall not be established upon the earth, evil shall hunt the cruel man to destruction.
140.12: I know that the Lord will avenge the afflicted, and judge the poor.
140.13: Surely the righteous shall praise thy Name, and the just shall dwell in thy presence.

141.1: O Lord, I call upon thee: haste thee unto me: hear my voice, when I cry unto thee.
141.2: Let my prayer be directed in thy sight as incense, and the lifting up of mine hands as an evening sacrifice.
141.3: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth, and keep the door of my lips.
141.4: Incline not mine heart to evil, that I should commit wicked works with them that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their delicates.
141.5: Let the righteous smite me: for that is a benefit: and let him reprove me, and it shall be a precious oil that shall not break mine head: for within a while I shall even pray in their miseries.
141.6: When their judges shall be cast down in stony places, they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.
141.7: Our bones lie scattered at the grave’s mouth, as he that heweth wood or diggeth in the earth.
141.8: But mine eyes look unto thee, O Lord God: in thee is my trust: leave not my soul destitute.
141.9: Keep me from the snare, which they have laid for me, and from the gins of the workers of iniquity.
141.10: Let the wicked fall into his nets together, while I escape.

142.1: I cried unto the Lord with my voice: with my voice I prayed unto the Lord.
142.2: I poured out my meditation before him, and declared mine affection in his presence.
142.3: Though my spirit was in perplexity in me, yet thou knewest my path: in the way wherein I walked, have they privily laid a snare for me.
142.4: I looked upon my right hand, and beheld, but there was none that would know me: all refuge failed me, and none cared for my soul.
142.5: Then cried I unto thee, O Lord, and said, Thou art mine hope, and my portion in the land of the living.
142.6: Hearken unto my cry, for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.
142.7: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy Name: then shall the righteous come about me, when thou art beneficial unto me.

143.1: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and hearken unto my supplication: answer me in thy truth, and in thy righteousness.
143.2: (And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall none that liveth, be justified.)
143.3: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul: he hath smitten my life down to the earth: he hath laid me in the darkness, as they that have been dead long ago:
143.4: And my spirit was in perplexity in me, and mine heart within me was amazed.
143.5: Yet do I remember the time past: I meditate in all thy works, yea, I do meditate in the works of thine hands.
143.6: I stretch forth mine hands unto thee: my soul desireth after thee, as the thirsty land. Selah.
143.7: Hear me speedily, O Lord, for my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, else I shall be like unto them that go down into the pit.
143.8: Let me hear thy loving-kindness in the morning, for in thee is my trust; show me the way, that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto thee.
143.9: Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies: for I hid me with thee.
143.10: Teach me to do thy will, for thou art my God: let thy good Spirit lead me unto the land of righteousness.
143.11: Quicken me, O Lord, for thy Name’s sake, and for thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
143.12: And for thy mercy slay mine enemies, and destroy all them that oppress my soul: for I am thy servant.

144.1: Blessed be the Lord my strength, which teacheth mine hands to fight, and my fingers to battle.
144.2: He is my goodness and my fortress, my tower and my deliverer, my shield and in him I trust, which subdueth my people under me.
144.3: Lord, what is man that thou regardest him! or the son of man that thou thinkest upon him?
144.4: Man is like to vanity; his days are like a shadow that vanisheth.
144.5: Bow thine heavens, O Lord, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
144.6: Cast forth the lightning and scatter them; shoot out thine arrows and consume them.
144.7: Send thine hand from above: deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, and from the hand of strangers,
144.8: Whose mouth talketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.9: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God, and sing unto thee upon a viol, and an instrument of ten strings.
144.10: It is he that giveth deliverance unto kings, and rescueth David his servant from the hurtful sword.
144.11: Rescue me, and deliver me from the hand of strangers, whose mouth talketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:
144.12: That our sons may be as the plants growing up in their youth, and our daughters as the corner stones, graven after the similitude of a palace:
144.13: That our corners may be full and abounding with divers sorts, and that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousand in our streets.
144.14: That our oxen may be strong to labor; that there be none invasion, nor going out, nor no crying in our streets.
144.15: Blessed are the people, that be so, yea blessed are the people whose God is the Lord.

145.1: O my God and King, I will extol thee, and will bless thy Name forever and ever.
145.2: I will bless thee daily, and praise thy Name forever and ever.
145.3: Great is the Lord, and most worthy to be praised, and his greatness is incomprehensible.
145.4: Generation shall praise thy works unto generation, and declare thy power.
145.5: I will meditate of the beauty of thy glorious majesty, and thy wonderful works.
145.6: And they shall speak of the power of thy dreadful acts, and I will declare thy greatness.
145.7: They shall break out into the mention of thy great goodness, and shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
145.8: The Lord is gracious, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great mercy.
145.9: The Lord is good to all, and his mercies are over all his works.
145.10: All thy works praise thee, O Lord, and thy Saints bless thee.
145.11: They show the glory of thy kingdom, and speak of thy power,
145.12: To cause his power to be known to the sons of men, and the glorious renown of his kingdom.
145.13: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all ages.
145.14: The Lord upholdeth all that fall, and lifteth up all that are ready to fall.
145.15: The eyes of all wait upon thee, and thou givest them their meat in due season.
145.16: Thou openest thine hand, and fillest all things living of thy good pleasure.
145.17: The Lord is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.
145.18: The Lord is near unto all that call upon him, yea, to all that call upon him in truth.
145.19: He will fulfill the desire of them that fear him; he will also hear their cry, and will save them.
145.20: The Lord preserveth all them that love him; but he will destroy the wicked.
145.21: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord, and all flesh shall bless his holy Name forever and ever.

146.1: Praise thou the Lord, O my soul.
146.2: I will praise the Lord during my life; as long as I have any being, I will sing unto my God.
146.3: Put not your trust in Princes, nor in the son of man, for there is no help in him.
146.4: His breath departeth, and he returneth to his earth; then his thoughts perish.
146.5: Blessed is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the Lord his God,
146.6: Which made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that therein is; which keepeth his fidelity forever,
146.7: Which executeth justice for the oppressed, which giveth bread to the hungry; the Lord looseth the prisoners.
146.8: The Lord giveth sight to the blind: the Lord raiseth up the crooked: the Lord loveth the righteous.
146.9: The Lord keepeth the strangers: he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but he overthroweth the way of the wicked.
146.10: The Lord shall reign forever: O Zion, thy God endureth from generation to generation. Praise ye the Lord.

147.1: Praise ye the Lord, for it is good to sing unto our God: for it is a pleasant thing, and praise is comely.
147.2: The Lord doth build up Jerusalem, and gather together the dispersed of Israel.
147.3: He healeth those that are broken in heart, and bindeth up their sores.
147.4: He counteth the number of the stars, and calleth them all by their names.
147.5: Great is our Lord, and great is his power: his wisdom is infinite.
147.6: The Lord relieveth the meek, and abaseth the wicked to the ground.
147.7: Sing unto the Lord with praise: sing upon the harp unto our God,
147.8: Which covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth, and maketh the grass to grow upon the mountains:
147.9: Which giveth to beasts their food, and to the young ravens that cry.
147.10: He hath no pleasure in the strength of an horse, neither delighteth he in the legs of man.
147.11: But the Lord delighteth in them that fear him, and attend upon his mercy.
147.12: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem: praise thy God, O Zion.
147.13: For he hath made the bars of the gates strong, and hath blessed thy children within thee.
147.14: He setteth peace in thy borders, and satisfieth thee with the flour of wheat.
147.15: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth, and his word runneth very swiftly.
147.16: He giveth snow like wool, and scattereth the hoary frost like ashes.
147.17: He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can abide the cold thereof?
147.18: He sendeth his word and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
147.19: He showeth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
147.20: He hath not dealt so with every nation, neither have they known his judgments. Praise ye the Lord.

148.1: Praise ye the Lord from the heaven: praise ye him in the high places.
148.2: Praise ye him, all ye his Angels: praise him, all his army.
148.3: Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise ye him all bright stars.
148.4: Praise ye him heavens of heavens, and waters, that be above the heavens.
148.5: Let them praise the Name of the Lord: for he commanded, and they were created.
148.6: And he hath established them forever and ever: he hath made an ordinance, which shall not pass.
148.7: Praise ye the Lord from the earth, ye dragons and all depths:
148.8: Fire and hail, snow and vapors, stormy wind, which execute his word.
148.9: Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees, and all cedars:
148.10: Beasts and all cattle, creeping things and feathered fowls:
148.11: Kings of the earth and all people, princes and all judges of the world:
148.12: Young men and maidens, also old men and children:
148.13: Let them praise the Name of the Lord: for his Name only is to be exalted, and his praise above the earth and the heavens.
148.14: For he hath exalted the horn of his people, which is a praise for all his Saints, even for the children of Israel, a people that is near unto him. Praise ye the Lord.

149.1: Sing ye unto the Lord a new song: let his praise be heard in the Congregation of Saints.
149.2: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him, and let the children of Zion rejoice in their King.
149.3: Let them praise his Name with the flute: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.
149.4: For the Lord hath pleasure in his people: he will make the meek glorious by deliverance.
149.5: Let the Saints be joyful with glory: let them sing loud upon their beds.
149.6: Let the high Acts of God be in their mouth, and a two edged sword in their hands,
149.7: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and corrections among the people:
149.8: To bind their kings in chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron,
149.9: That they may execute upon them the judgment that is written: this honor shall be to all his Saints. Praise ye the Lord.

150.1: Praise ye God in his Sanctuary: praise ye him in the firmament of his power.
150.2: Praise ye him in his mighty Acts: praise ye him according to his excellent greatness.
150.3: Praise ye him in the sound of the trumpet: praise ye him upon the viol and the harp.
150.4: Praise ye him with timbrel and flute: praise ye him with virginals and organs.
150.5: Praise ye him with sounding cymbals: praise ye him with high sounding cymbals.
150.6: Let everything that hath breath praise the Lord. Praise ye the Lord.
